loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 52-year-old married woman with three children.

Josefina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years, and has borrowed from NWTF 10 times in the past.

In the future, Josefina would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 43-year-old married woman with nine children, four of whom are in school.

Julita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

She has been in this business for 10 years, and has borrowed from NWTF 10 times in the past.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock.

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es: Rafael de 25 años es un emprendedor que encontró en las artesanías una oportunidad de negocio para surgir en la vida y costear sus estudios, con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le sembraron el capital inicial logró comprar sus primeros productos entre ellos hamacas, bolsos y mochilas,  elaborados en san Jacinto una región destacada por la elaboración de sus artesanías e incluso es  considerado como el primer centro artesanal de la costa Atlántica y el primer comercializador de productos elaborados en telar vertical como hamacas y su diversificación, también produce productos elaborados en croché y macramé, así como productos de la madera, la talabartería y los instrumentos de gaita entre otros. Sus principales clientes se encuentran ubicados en otras ciudades a quienes les vende por pedidos y de contado, sin embargo su capital le es insuficiente para continuar con un manejo oportuno de sus pedidos, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de hamacas, mochilas, bolsos e hilaza para tejer hamacas y bolsos, puesto que él es oriundo de San Jacinto y es poseedor de este arte. Su meta a futuro es vender más variedad de productos,  terminar sus estudios y casarse.
texts.en:
Rafael is 25 years old. He is an entrepreneur who saw in arts and crafts an opportunity for business in order to come up in life and fund his studies. With the support of his parents who raised the initial money he was able to buy his first products; among which were hammocks, bags, and backpacks made in San Jacinto. This is a region known for making arts and crafts and is even considered the first craft center of the Atlantic coast and the first marketer of products produced on a vertical loom like hammocks and their variety. The region also produces crochet and macrame products, as well as wooden products, saddlery, and instruments like the guitar and others.

Rafael's main customers are located in other cities. He sells to them through orders and installments. Nevertheless, his capital is insufficient in order to continue timely management of his orders, which is why he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest this in the purchase of hammocks, backpacks, bags, and yarn for making hammocks and bags, since he is a native of San Jacinto and possesses this art.

His goal for the future is to sell a greater variety of products, to finish his studies, and to get married.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, backpacks, bags, and yarn for sewing hammocks and bags.

loans.name: Segundo Angel

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre trabajador,tiene 30 años, su estado civil es soltero,tiene 1 hijo, esta dedicado especialmente a la venta y siembra de papas, habas, arveja, ademas cria pollos y cerdos. Por medio de este prestamo, Segundo podra acceder a la compra de abonos para de esta forma incrementar su produccion, el como muchas personas aspiran, el sueño de el es de tener su vehiculo propio.
En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Segundo is a hardworking, 30 year-old, single man. He has one son and works growing and selling potatoes, lima beans, peas, and also breeding chickens and pigs. 

With this loan, Segundo will be able to purchase fertilizers in order to increase his production. Like many people, Segundo's dream is to have his own vehicle. 

In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and people in his community.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres   emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DEL VALLE TRIUNFO”.  La Sra. Lucia  de 52 años de edad y casada. Tiene como negocio una bodega (venta de productos comestibles) en su propio domicilio. La Sra. Lucia ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más  su negocio y poder vender más variedad de  productos que le generaran mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería (productos comestibles) y así  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Lucia  y todos los integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado. La Sra. Lucia es la que se encuentra en el medio y viste una blusa  color rosado claro y pantalón color plomo. Se despide  dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
A group made up of 5 enterprising women with a lot of creativity in business -- they are the members of the communal bank "Emprendedoras del Valle Triunfo" [Entrepreneurs of the Triunfo Valley].

Lucia is 52 years old and marred. She has a bodega business (selling groceries) out of her own house. Lucia has been able to build loyalty among her customers, which has generated her enough income to cover her household expenses.

In the future, she would like to expand her business more and to be able to sell a greater variety of products, which will generate more income.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise (groceries), so she will continue satisfying her customers' needs and be able to get ahead.

Lucia and all the group members are grateful to Kiva for the loan, and for the trust it has in them. Lucia is the one is the middle wearing a light pink blouse and silver pants.

She closes by promising to fulfill all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries)

loans.name: Jeanalie

texts.en:
Jeanalie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeanalie is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jeanalie has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jeanalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dry goods like slippers, blouses and t-shirts to sell to her customers.

Jeanalie has been in this business for 4 years. Jeanalie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods like slippers, blouses and t-shirts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Edilito

texts.en: Edilito is a 26-year-old fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three young children ages 1, 3 and 8. He has been fishing for six years to support his family. Edilito is asking for a loan to buy materials that he can use to renovate his house such as cinder blocks, hard wood and nails. With this he will be able to give his family a decent home while he continues fishing for a living. Edilito hopes to make his business a success. He also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, hard wood and nails.

loans.name: Jenevev

texts.en:
Jenevev is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenevev is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jenevev has a business selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Jenevev requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like flower pots and fertilizers for her business.

Jenevev has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jenevev would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like flower pots and fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a computer shop in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional computer for her business.

Lina has been in this business for 5 years. Lina earns more income from frozen food vending.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Pinos Verdes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PINOS VERDES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, venta de mantas, venta de condimentos, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, ferretería, venta de calzados, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de fierros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tienen dos hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Green Pines ['Pinos Verdes'] Communal Association will begin its first financing cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Focal Point. It is composed of 8 members and is headed by a board of directors where Mrs. Silvia is the President. The businesses brought forward by the communal association members vary among them: socks sales, blanket sales, condiment sales, clothing sales, furniture sales, hardware, shoe sales, and appliance sales.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, among whom Mrs. Silvia is a member. She indicates that it took two years to join Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Today, she has a hardware business. She makes it known that she learned this business through her own initiative over several years. Currently, her husband helps her in her business.

This loan will be for the augmentation of capital through the wholesale purchase of iron that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in El Alto city. Later, she will commercialize it in her shop. This form of work permits her to generate financial means to support her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase iron wholesale.

loans.name: Las Costanera Group

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes y cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, amable y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad área caracterizada por el comercio manufacturero en todas sus áreas.
Karina es trigueña de ojos marrones y cabello castaño (sentada al centro), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa familiar construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. la necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevo a formar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de comida, venta de productos naturales para la salud, lavandería, venta de empanadas, venta de refrescos y venta de horneados típicos. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes como; fideo, azúcar, arroz, harina, aceite y otros, en una esquina de su tienda tiene un mostrador donde expone a la venta perfumes, aretes, lápices labiales y otros, “las señoras vienen por insumos de cocina y también se llevan algunos cosméticos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ambas las realiza en un mismo lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer ambos negocios. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio incrementando la oferta de abarrotes y cosméticos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza ambas actividades. Es por esos motivos que Karina solicita un préstamo para comprar abarrotes y cosméticos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina is a 38 year-old woman who lives with her partner and has three children who are 3, 10 and 12 years old. She works selling groceries and cosmetics. She is entrepreneurial, kind and reliable. She does her business in the southern area of the city which is know for its manufacturing industry.

Karina is brunette with brown eyes and brown hair (she is seated in the middle). Her maternal language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She lives alongside her partner who works in construction and her children who go to school. They live in a brick home with all the basic amenities. 

The need to improve her business led her to form an entrepreneurial bank made up of businesses selling products such as: second hand clothing; food; natural health products; laundry services; stuffed pastries; soft drinks; and typical baked goods. 

Her business is selling groceries such as noodles, sugar, rice, flour, oil and other goods. She has a display case in a corner of her store where she displays perfumes, earrings, lipsticks and other products for sale. She says that "women come in for kitchen goods and end up buying some cosmetics too."

The advantage of her business is that she can sell both types of products in the same place. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock both of her businesses. Her dream is to improve her business by increasing the supply of groceries and cosmetics. This is the first loan she has applied for with the institution in three years that she has been involved in these two businesses. Karina is asking for a loan in order to purchase groceries and cosmetics to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and cosmetics to stock her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cecilia works hard to support her family. 

She has a computer shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 52 years old and married with two children. Monina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as rice, beverages, canned goods, home  product care, and other groceries.

Monina has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to build her businesses further.

In the future, Monina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice, beverages, canned goods, home  product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines is a married woman who lives in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 44 years old and has three children. Ines's husband is a fisherman. She works with her husband doing the fishing. She sells his catch at their town's market. Ines is doing her best to improve their business and her family's living conditions. With that, she also prepares fresh fish to make dried fish. Dried fish has a high demand in the Philippines.  She requested a loan to buy fishing nets, rice for consumption and pay for tuition fees of her children. She hopes for a better income so she can sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, rice for consumption and pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 50 years old now.

Nelia has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Nelia  has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is 37 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Rosel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sukertibala

texts.en:
Sukertibala is a happy mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She is a 41-year-old woman who hails from Falakata. Her husband is a cultivator engaged in farming. Her son reads in college and her daughter reads in grade 12. They live in their own small house in Dalimpur village in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal.

As the earning of Sukertibala's husband is inconsistent, she earns a living for the family by rearing cattle. Sukertibala wants her family to be happy and to have a good life. She has been involved in animal husbandry for two years. Every morning, she milks the cows and then sells the milk at the market where the demand is high. She derives a good income from this activity.

She now wants to increase her cattle to earn more, to cope with the growing price of essential commodities but she doesn't have enough money to do so. This is the reason why she has turned to Kiva's partner BJS for financial assistance. She is hoping to get some support to receive the money needed to keep her small business going. She will use the loan to buy another cow for her milk-selling business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her business.

loans.name: Tonis Arnoldo

texts.es:
Tonis, de 40 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, respetable y y sobre todo honesto, estudio hasta noveno grado, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de pollos y de cerdos, está acompañado y junto a su pareja han procreado cuatro hijos, de 18, 14, 11 y 8 años de edad. 

Tonis, desde muy pequeño cultiva la tierra junto a su padre, fue él quien le enseño a trabajar, ya tiene 18 años de trabajar de manera propia sembrando 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y tiene 14 años de trabajar como cobrador de buses del transporte público, de esa manera lleva el sustento a su familia y obtiene los ingresos económico para seguir mandando a sus hijos a estudiar todos los días.
 
El Crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, fertilizantes y para comprar seis cerdos y 200 pollos de engorde, de esta manera generar los ingresos para su familia y además mejorará sus condiciones de vida y ampliará sus trabajos agrícolas.
 
Tonis, desea seguir cultivando la tierra y ampliar más sus negocios, para darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta que se gradúen de una carrera universitaria, además a futuro quiere poner una granja de cerdos y pollos bastante fuerte y construir unas galeras más amplias.
texts.en:
Tonis, 40 years old, is hard working, respectable and above all honest. He has a ninth-grade education. He works in agriculture, and raising chickens and pigs. He is accompanied by his partner. They have raised four children, aged 18, 14, 11 and 8.

Tonis has cultivated the land since he was very young, working alongside his father. It was his father who taught him to work. He now has been working on his own for 18 years, planting 14,000 square meters with corn. He has also been working for 14 years as a fare collector in public transportation buses. This way, he brings support to his family and earns the income to continue sending his children to school every day.

The loan is needed for him to buy manure and fertilizers, and to buy six pigs and 200 broiler chickens. This way, he can generate income for his family, and in addition can improve their living conditions and expand his agricultural work.

Tonis wishes to continue farming, and continue to grow his businesses, to be able to provide his children with an education until they graduate with a university degree. In addition, in the future he would like to have a well-constructed chicken and pig farm, and construct some larger enclosures.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers, and to buy six pigs and 200 broiler chickens.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a 28-year-old rural married woman who is a mother of two sons. Her two sons are studying in school in different grades. Her husband is a farmer by profession, involved with agriculture. They live in a small village in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar.

Ratna works hard every day from the early morning to dusk. Her family's main activity and source of income is the cultivation of paddy rice. One of the challenges they come across is the maintenance of their crops due to the high prices of the farm inputs. As they are so expensive, the harvest with which she is left is sometimes too low to sell. So the income they earn is also insufficient to maintain their household expenses. In this situation, they require good quality farm resources that they lack.

Thus Ratna has applied for the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase good quality farm supplies like paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. on a huge scale and to maintain the operational cost for farming paddy. She hopes to get a better income from their business and plans to save for the future to purchase some farming land for them.

She thanks her lenders very much for their help.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sadhana

texts.en:
Sadhana is a 36-year-old rural housewife from a small village in Falakata in West Bengal, India. She lives there with her husband and two sons who are students. Sadhana and her husband could not complete their education due to their families’ financial problems.

Sadhana’s husband is a farmer. To take care of the family's needs, he is extensively engaged in an agribusiness. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family. In order to continue developing their agribusiness in a sustainable way, they plan to cultivate paddies on their farmland. Thus, Sadhana needs capital to invest in their business. So she has taken out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan amount to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, other farm resources, etc. and the rest of the amount will be used to pay for the additional operational costs of farming.

Sadhana dreams that this business will enable her to earn extra profit, which will give financial support to her family to fulfill their basic needs and educate her sons properly. She dreams of purchasing more farm land in the future with the profit from the business.

Sadhana sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase farm resources and to bear the operational cost of farming paddies.

loans.name: Pali

texts.en:
Pali is a very energetic woman of 41 years from Falakata, a town located in Alipurduar district. She studied up to grade 12. She is blessed with one daughter who is studying in grade three. Unfortunately, she lost her husband and Pali is the only earning member of her family.

Pali faces many difficulties to manage their household expenses. She is hardworking and responsible with a great desire for her personal as well her family's success. She runs a grocery store. She sells food products and grocery items in her shop such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, detergent, etc. to her neighborhood and local villagers. Due to the lack of capital, she can’t purchase sufficient stock for her grocery shop and at present, there is almost nothing left in her store to sell. The customers go back to not getting anything. Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.

The objective for her loan is to buy a variety of food items and grocery items in bulk for her grocery store so that she can earn more by fulfilling her customers’ requirements. She is hopeful to give good financial sustenance to her family.

Pali is thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items in bulk for her existing grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Felicidad

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA FELICIDAD es una persona joven, trabajadora de 40 años de edad de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con seis dependientes económicos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, es de construcción rustica con material local, ubicado en la comunidad de Tola Pampa - Tiraque, su actividad económica es la agrícola en tal sentido produce papa, papalisa y haba en vaina verde, todos los productos mencionados son cultivados aproximadamente en una superficie de 5 has. Los cuales cuentan con riego, ya que es aplicado por inundación. El dinero que tenía anteriormente fue destinado para la compra de dos vacas lecheras, en ese sentido la señora requiere un préstamo para poder comprar semilla de papa y abono orgánico (gallinaza), con la producción en el futuro, con la intención de mejorar  sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo mejorara, una mejor vivencia familiar.
texts.en:
Maria Felicidad is a young, hardworking, 40 year-old married woman. She was able to finish primary school and has six people who are financially dependent on her. She lives in her own home, which is a rustic construction of local materials, located in the community of Tola Pampa, Tiraque.

Her business is agriculture; she grows potatoes, papaliso [a root vegetable], and green beans, all produced in a five-hectare area. The crops have flood irrigation. The money she had before was used for buying dairy cows. Maria Felicidad needs a loan in order to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer (manure). 

With her future production she hopes to improve her income and at the same time improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer in order to improve her production with the intention of increasing her income and improving her family's lifestyle.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 58 years old and married with four children. One of her children is in school. Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, spices, home product care, and other groceries.

Vicenta has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, spices, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 49-year-old widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Wilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Wilma has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

Wilma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Ulai

texts.en:
Ulai lives in Gashipara village in Kandi, West Bengal. She is a 42-year-old widow. She has a family comprised of five members: she, her one son and three daughters. Her son reads in college and her daughters are all married. Ulai is illiterate but can sign her name.

As she has lost her husband, the entire family depends on Ulai. She is engaged in Bidi binding works and earns a scanty income. But she has a Toto rickshaw (a battery-operated auto rickshaw), which has become a very popular vehicle in rural areas for carrying people short distances. This Toto rickshaw is the main source of income for the family. At present, her son-in-law is driving the Toto rickshaw but her son is in the learning process. Now the Toto rickshaw needs some repairs and the tires and tubes are damaged so it needs a change of tires and tubes so that it will be suitable for use on roads.

As Ulai has no capital, she applied for a business loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to repair the Toto rickshaw and purchase new tires and tubes for it. She hopes that the income will increase as well as strengthen the family economy.

She expresses her gratitude towards her generous lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the repair costs of her Toto rickshaw.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four dependents, aged 7 to 17. Her husband works as a driver to their motorcycle, offering habal-habal (motorcycle transport) rides to the locals for income. Araceli herself has farmed rice to help her husband in raising their family. 

Araceli is applying for an 8,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy fertilizer. The loan will help her continue her farming while also supporting the basic needs of her family. She will use all her farming income to pay for healthy food for her family and school fees for her children.

In the future, Araceli hopes to be successful by continuing to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 42-year-old woman living in Falakata. She is a mother of three children (two sons and a daughter). Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years back. Two of her children go to school and the elder one is unemployed. They live in their own small house in the village of Harinathpur in Alipurduar district.

Sabitri is the only earner of the family and she earns a living for the family by rearing cattle. Sabitri wants her family to be happy and to have a good life. She has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 10 years. Every morning, she milks the cows and then sells their milk at the market where the demand is high. She derives a good income from this activity.

She now wants to increase her cattle to earn more to cope with the growing price of essential commodities but she doesn't have enough money to invest in her business. Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She is hoping to get some support to receive the money needed to keep her small business going. She will use the loan to buy another cow for her business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her business.

loans.name: Cristituta

texts.en:
Cristituta is a married woman with six children from Bein Unido, Bohol.

She has been engaged in the rice farming business for many years now. She also earn a living by being a herbal supplement dealer. This is the source of her income.

Cristituta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and more herbal supplements. These will increase her income and help for the daily expenses of her family, like food. In the future, Cristituta dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more herbal supplements.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, ages 13, 14, and 17.

Her husband does not earn much from fishing and being a laborer for coconut farmers. Being a coconut laborer for farmers means that he is doing all the climbing of the coconut trees to harvest the coconuts.

She in turn helps him by selling snacks. She cooks pancakes and sells popsicles to earn an income. She is asking a loan to buy sugar, flour, milk, and margarine.

Rowena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services the organization offers. With the loan, Rowena will be able to buy the ingredients to increase what she produces and hope to have a bigger profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, milk, and margarine.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman with two children, ages six and seven.

Aida has been in the fish vending business for four years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and to buy materials to renovate her house.

With this investment, she can be assured of higher sales and can give her family a decent home. In the future, Aida hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish and materials for house renovation like hardwood and nails.

loans.name: Cecel

texts.en:
Cecel is 28 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman with two son, ages 6 and 8. Her husband is a carpenter. To help him, Cecel sells snacks to earn an income. She cooks pancake and noodles and sells them in her community. She also raise hogs for an income. 

Cecel works hard to earn a living through her businesses. These businesses provide her with income that she needs for their expenses. 
Cecel is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy feed, flour, sugar, noodles, and margarine. She believes that, if she will be provided support through loans, she will be able to improve her business to generate more revenue. Cecel dreams of seeing her family experiencing fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy feed, flour, sugar, noodles, and margarine.

loans.name: Sasti

texts.en:
Sasti is a married woman of 27 years. She received an education up to grade six. She lives with her husband Bimal and her two children in their own small house in a small village in Falakata, West Bengal, India. Both of her children (a son and a daughter) are studying in school.

Sasti's husband is a farmer; he is a hardworker and a very enterprising man. He works on their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow a variety of crops according to the seasonal demand, which he sells in the local market and earns money for their livelihood. Now they decided to grow paddy on their land, as it is a very beneficial crop and also is in great demand. Being a staple, paddy cultivation is a very profitable business for them.

Thus, Sasti requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. so that her husband can grow good quality paddy on their land. Sasti's hopes and dreams are to be able to expand their business to give good financial support to her family and give a better education to their children.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for growing paddy.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a married woman of 23 years. She studied up to grade nine. She lives with her husband, Sujit, in the small village of Raychenga in Falakata. They are blessed with one son who is six years old and studying in grade one.

Sabita’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for three years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and an all-season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for the paddy cultivation.

Sabita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality fertilizer and seeds for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to get a good paddy harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business for earning a better income. She dreams of expanding their agribusiness by purchasing a small piece of land in the future with the generated profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers for their existing paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah is 31 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with six children, ages 3 to 11.

Devorah runs a business selling second-hand branded clothing locally known as a Ukay-ukay. Her business is thriving, but she needs additional capital so that she can buy more clothes to sell.

She is asking for a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy more shorts, shirts, and skirts to sell. The loan will pave the way for her to have a better income. In the future, she hopes that her children will be successful in their studies and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy shorts, shirts, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna, a 40-year-old woman, stays in a small village called Mahakalpara in Falakata, in the Alipuduar district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is studying in college and her daughter is in grade 12. Ratna takes care of her livestock and her husband is engaged in a fast food shop.

Ratna has a cow in her herd and sells milk to the villagers. Her husband’s income is quite inadequate for the family so Ratna devotes her full time to her small milk-selling business to support her family. Beside this, she also sells cow dung, which is used as manure in the farm land. Because of the growing expenses of essential daily commodities, it has become necessary for her to increase her income. She now wants to expand her business by buying a new dairy cow. So Ratna seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

She will use the loan money to buy a dairy cow. She is very hopeful that this investment will help her to earn some extra income and help her to save money to provide a better education to her children and strengthen her family's economy.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra tiene 32 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia y humilde desde hace varios años, junto a su esposo. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una venta de helados muy reconocida desde hace varios años, gracias a su dedicación y esmero logra sacar adelante a su familia y llevar el sustento a su hogar, es reconocida por sus vecinos como una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Sandra desea construir un baño y una pila en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un baño con pila en su vivienda y de esta manera abonar a la sanidad de su hogar, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old. She has lived in her humble home with her husband for several years. She makes a living by selling ice cream and has been well-known for several years. Thanks to her care and dedication, she has been able to provide for her family and put food on the table.

She is known by her neighbors to be a very hard-working and responsible woman. Sandra wants to install a bathroom and a sink in her home. She is applying for a loan from FUSAI so that she can buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to put a bathroom and a sink in her house. She hopes to be able to improve sanitation in her home with this aid.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a bathroom with a sink in her home.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: In Kitale area of Kenya it is normal to have a chicken farm, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely. Jackline is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kitale. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years. To earn a decent living she sells different variety of farm produce and engages in numerous small personal businesses or “side hustles” as she likes to call them. Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money off poultry farming. To Jackline, raising hens is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs, but figures the quantity she produces won't make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. Jackline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life. Jackline is aware of how important education is to her children. Her dream is to give them the best education she can, and that’s why she works so hard. Don’t let this dream fail; help Jackline with the loan she needs and let her improve her business and her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming rice to earn a living. Farming is very challenging since Bohol province also experiences typhoons on a yearly basis. Still Eulalia perseveres and works hard for her family. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing to cultivate the land. Her loan will allow her to continue her earning her livelihood and wait for the next four months for the harvest. She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her business profit and the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her husband and five dependents aged nine to nineteen. She is in the business of hog raising and food vending to support her children. Her husband also drives a motorcycle to provide income.
Erlinda gives her best to provide support for the needs of the family and her business provides her with the living that she needs.
She wants to expand her business and she is requesting for a loan to buy feed for the hogs that she is raising. With the loan, she will be able to make her business sustainable and productive.
Erlinda wants to earn more so that she will have the financial capacity to send her children to school for learning. She believes that education is important for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with ten children, three of them are still dependents. He provides for their needs by farming rice to earn a living. In addition, he also farms fruit trees like mango. He is asking a loan to buy fungicide spray for mangoes. This is needed so he can produce more fruits and to repel pests on mango fruits. He wants to give his kids a better future. With this, his profit will be used to finance his  children’s schooling and future savings.

loans.use: to buy fungicide spray for mangoes.

loans.name: Natacha

texts.fr: Natacha a 32 ans. Elle est célibataire et sans enfants à charge. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Elle fait face régulièrement à des ruptures de stock. Cela lui fait perdre des clients. Pour éviter les ruptures de stock, elle a recours au microcrédit. Elle rêve de devenir une grande commerçante et d’être autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
Natacha is thirty-two years old, single and has no children. She sells food products but often runs out of stock which loses her customers.

Natacha has requested a loan in order to build up her stock levels. She dreams of becoming a big shop keeper and being financially independent

loans.use: to buy sacks of macaroni and boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Famille Mubalama Group

texts.fr: Suivant les déclarations de Burafiki, leur premier crédit leur a servi à entretenir leur champ de café et à prendre en location d'autres champs auprès de caféiculteurs pour la récolte prochaine. Les revenus générés ont permis à la famille d'assurer la scolarité des enfants durant l'année scolaire passée, constituer une petite épargne et démarrer une petite activité génératrice de revenus. ce deuxième crédit leur sera d'une grande utilité dans le cadre d'idéés.
texts.en:
Burafiki used his first loan to take care of his coffee field and rent other fields to increase his next crop levels.

The profits generated by this allowed the family to pay for school fees last year, set aside some savings and start another money-generating activity.

This second loan will be useful to help them implement some of the other ideas they have.

loans.use: to take care of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Mère de six enfants, Albertine est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans vivant à Agoè. Albertine est une marchande de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois, Albertine nécessite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Albertine is forty-four years old, married and mother to six children. She lives in Agoè and sells charcoal. Twice a month she buys new stock from the market and sells it from the front of her house.

This loan will buy sacks of charcoal. Albertine's earnings will help her husband to pay for school fees for this academic year.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Agée de 52 ans, Afi est une femme dynamique et courageuse qui vend des sacs d’écoliers et de sorties au marché et à domicile afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de sacs de sorties et d’écoliers afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Afi is fifty-two years old, married and is responsible for four children. She lives in Adidogomé and is dynamic and courageous. She sells school bags and assorted other bags at the market and from her home. This activity earns a good living. Twice a month Afi buys new stocks from the market.

This loan will buy travel bags and school bags. Afi's earnings will provide for the day-to-day needs of her family and help her husband to pay for school fees for this academic year.

loans.use: to buy 20 units of assorted bags and 20 units of school bags.

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is 45 years old. He is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has been a rice farmer many years now. His four children are ages seven to nineteen.

The previous harvest season has been good to him, and so he is looking forward to a better income this time around. He applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for the labor of hired farmers. This will help his crops to thrive and increase his yield. He hopes to have a better profit out of his farming so he can buy some things for his house. The additional income will go to savings and nutritious meals for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pay for the labor of hired farmers.

loans.name: Teotima

texts.en: Teotima hails from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 52 years old and relies in farming and operating a Sari-sari store for a living. She has been farming for fifteen years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seasoning, toiletries, canned food and sugar. She wanted to increase her income so she can buy the basic needs of her household, like healthy meals, and pay for electricity. Any additional income will be for savings, school fees of her three school-aged children, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seasoning, toiletries, canned food and sugar

loans.name: Ayaba Célestine

texts.fr: Ayaba est une veuve femme dynamique qui vit à Baguida avec deux enfants à charge. Ayaba est âgée de 41 ans et s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Ayaba est une revendeuse de tissus qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ayaba sollicite ce prêt pour commander des mètres de tissus pantalons et chemises afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a dynamic, widowed woman who lives in Baguida and is responsible for two children. She is forty-one years old and works hard to generate enough income to support her family.

Ayaba sells fabric from her home and in the surrounding districts. She buys her supplies from the market.

Ayaba has requested this loan to achieve her aim of ordering fabrics to make trousers and shirts. This will respond to the needs of her customers and provide her with enough financial resources to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 10 metres of fabric to make trousers and 12 metres of fabric to make shirts.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with two children living in Masindi-Uganda. She owns a bar but also sells soft drinks like sodas. She is a hard working woman with a bigger dream of moving from poverty to riches. Harriet hopes to develop her business for more profits. Her problem is inadequate capital to start up a snacks service for which her customers have a demand. She requests a loan to buy sodas and beers for selling.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for selling.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a very hard-working married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 10 children, six of whom attend school in Hoima Uganda. He carries out crop production predominantly, growing beans, soya beans, and gnuts among others. He intends to grow and expand his business to improve his family's standard of living. He is only limited by inadequate capital. He is seeking for the loan facility to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.use: to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina es madre de 3 hijos, es de Chuquisaca y se vino al trópico en busca de una mayor oportunidad de vida para su familia junto a su cónyuge, la señora Marina empezó a cultivar sus productos en un terreno en alquiler donde sembró algunos productos constantemente para sobresalir y trabajar junto a su pareja, empezaron con 1 has de plátano y llegaron a ampliar su producción hasta 3 has, pero debido a la inundación de los ríos se llevo gran parte de su producción, actualmente tiene dos has que están en producción como también tiene y siembra cítricos, la señora fue afectada por estos cambios climáticos, pero con el apoyo de algunos de sus compañeros de su sindicato se encuentra recuperando su producción, la señora es una persona responsable y trabajadora, su actividad económica es la agricultura, es por ello que requiere el préstamo para seguir ampliando la producción de plátano como también de yuca y cítricos para solventar a la familia y sobresalir y tener una vida mejor
texts.en:
Marina is the mother of 3 children. She is from Chuquisaca and came to the tropics in search of a greater opportunity for her family alongside her partner. Marina began to grow her products on a rented land where she planted some products constantly to excel and work with her partner.

She started with 1 hectare of banana and managed to increase her production to 3 hectares, but due to the flooding of the rivers, a large part of her production was swept away. Now she has two hectares that are in production, and she also has and plants citrus fruits. She was affected by these climate changes but with the help of some of her friends from the union, she is recovering her production.

She is a responsible and hard-working person. Her work is in agriculture. For that reason, she needs the loan to continue increasing banana production, as well as yucca and citrus fruits, to cover the family, excel and have a better life.

loans.use: to increase banana production, as well as yucca and citrus fruits, to cover the family, excel and have a better life.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children, one of whom is already an adult. She lives in Bien Unido with her family. Emily has been engaged in a rice farming and fishing business with her husband for a long time now. She also farms seaweed as an additional source of income.

Lorna is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope. With the loan, Emily and her husband will be able to improve their business. In the future, Emily hopes to make her business sustainable to support the education of her children ages four, seven and fifteen.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with 3 children living in Hoima-Uganda. He farms mostly cassava and beans for selling. He has been able to raise enough income to support his family, supplemented by income from operating a retail shop. He hopes to grow and expand his businesses and also educate his children.

His businesses are faced with challenges of seasonality, and changes and price fluctuations of retail products. He is seeking a loan to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Javier Omar

texts.es: Javier es un joven productor agrícola muy esforzado, principalmente cultiva chayote. Solicita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares ($250), para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios para el buen desarrollo de este cultivo. Esto le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Javier is a young hardworking agricultural producer, he primarily grows vegetable pear. He is asking for a loan of two hundred and fifty dollars ($250), to buy the agricultural supplies needed for the successful development of the crop.This will allow him to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow vegetable pear.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in rice farming to earn an income. She works hard to provide for her three children ages 6, 10 and 11.

She is asking for a loan of PHP7000 to buy fertilizer for her farm which is required for successful rice farming. It is her dream to see her children become professionals and live a life that is abundant and prosperous.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 45 years old and the mother of four children aged 12-17. She and her husband farm rice in the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been farming since having her family which has been their source of livelihood. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance.

She requested a loan to buy fertilizer and piglets so she can start a hog raising business too. The income that she can get from this business will be use for her children's daily meals, school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Ngaro Ebiri Sinabaniya Group

texts.en:
Scola is 67 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. All her children attend secondary school; she also takes care of four dependents in the family. She buys and sells cocoa as her major source of income, and gets additional income from growing and selling fresh foods -- mainly beans and tomatoes -- in markets. She started her business 30 years ago and works 12 hours a day to generate income.

Her challenges are competition and unpredictable weather changes which affect her sales and profitability. She would like to educate her children in the University; her business hope for the future is to expand her cocoa trading and farming. She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La señora Lucy vive en el área rural con su pareja, en calidad de concubinos, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda  es rustica de adobe con techo de teja española, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su conyugue para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva 5 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, habas, cebada y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Lucy se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo económico para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lucy lives in a rural area with her common law spouse. She achieved a primary education. Her home is rustic, made from adobe with a Spanish tile roof. It lacks some basic services. She is a hardworking person who works day to day with a lot of optimism with her spouse in order to obtain income to support themselves. She works mainly in agriculture. She has been doing this activity for approximately 5 years. She grows and sells what she grows. She takes what she grows to provincial markets in the region and in nearby towns. The main products she grows are potatoes in large quantities, beans, barley and more in small quantities, generally for her own consumption. Lucy needs to ask for a loan to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure). This way, she will expand her production and continue with her sales and obtain income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to expand production and sales and obtain better income to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Hector Samuel

texts.es: Héctor es un hombre trabajador de 41 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mariscos, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años, por lo que gracias a su gran experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Héctor es un hombre muy responsable que logro cumplir su sueño de una vivienda digna desde hace 2 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz, además gracias a su trabajo logra apoyar económicamente a su hijo que aunque no vive con él, Héctor siempre trata de darle lo mejor. Héctor desea mejorar su negocio, ya que cada día sus clientes solicitan mayor cantidad de productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pescado, conchas, camarones, langostas, cangrejos, entre otros productos muy solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Héctor is a hard-working man at 41 years of age who makes a living by selling shellfish, which he has been doing for 25 years. Thanks to his extensive experience, he has a large amount of clients that ask for his products.

Héctor is a very responsible man who has achieved his dream of having decent housing for two years now, which makes him very happy. Furthermore, thanks to his job he can economically support his son to whom Héctor always tries to give the best, even though he doesn't live with him.

Héctor wants to better his business and since every day his clients ask for more and more products, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: fish, seashells, prawns, lobsters and crabs, among other products requested by his clients.

loans.use: to invest in: fish, seashells, prawns, lobsters and crabs, among other products requested by his clients.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides es un microempresario residente en Cartagena y a sus 41 años de edad es un panadero con una amplia trayectoria; a sus 10 años de edad aprendió a elaborar productos de panadería cuando trabajó en una panadería y repostería, desde entonces éste ha sido su oficio y en el año 2014, tomó la decisión de usar toda su experiencia en su proyecto de negoció. En su panadería maneja una amplia gama de productos, pues elabora todo tipo de panes, galletas y postres, él es muy constante y responsable en su labor, todos los días provee a triciclos que recorren las calles del municipio y comercializan sus productos, así como directamente en el local atiende a sus clientes, quienes realizan sus compras de contado a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. de lunes a sábado.  Esta actividad le ha proveído el sustento y bienestar necesario, también para velar por el bienestar de sus dos hijos que a pesar de estar separado de su compañera sentimental, asume su responsabilidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en insumos de panadería para la preparación de sus productos.  Su meta a futuro es crecer en su negocio y ampliar la flota de triciclos hasta llegar a 10 unidades, que le permitan tener ganancias suficientes para comprar su casa propia.
texts.en: Alcides is a micro-businessman who lives in Cartagena. At 41 years old, he is a bread baker with a lot of experience. At 10 years old, he learned to make bread products when he worked in a bread and pastry bakery. Since then, this has been his trade, and in 2014, he decided to use all of his experience in his business project. In his bread bakery, he manages a wide variety of products. He makes all types of bread, cookies and desserts. He is very stable and responsible in his work. He is a provider every day to tricycles that drive through the city streets every day and sell the products. He also sells directly from his locale, serving customers who pay up front starting at 9 a.m. until 5 p.m., Monday through Saturday. This activity has provided him with the support and well being he needs, and he has also been able to watch over the well being of his two children. Despite being separated from his partner, he assumes responsibility. Right now, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in bread bakery products to prepare his products. His goal for the future is to grow in his business and expand the flotilla of tricycles until he has 10 units. This will allow him to have enough profits to buy his own house.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients for bread baking to prepare his products.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Doña Sabina se dedica a la cría de pollo de engorde los cuales posteriormente comercializa en la comunidad. Solicita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares ($250), para la compra de pollos y alimentación para los mismos. Con esto planea logrará mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Sabina raises broiler chickens which she later sells in the community. She is asking for a loan of two hundred and fifty dollars ($250) to buy chickens and their feed for them. With this, she plans to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens.

loans.name: Famille Karhangale Group

texts.fr: La prise en charge de travaux de sarclage et de paillage font à ce que Pascal sollicite un deuxième crédit. Il reconnaît les œuvres positives qu'il a pu réaliser grâce à son premier crédit dont le paiement sans difficulté de frais scolaires de ses enfants, l'entretien de son champ de café et l'achat d'un champ pour la culture du manioc.
texts.en: Pascal is requesting this second loan to pay for his plot of land to be hoed and fertilized. He recognizes the positive effects brought about thanks to his first loan, which he used to easily pay for his children's school fees, the maintenance of his coffee plantation and the purchase of a plot of land for growing cassava.

loans.use: to hoe their coffee plant field and fertilize it.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es una ama de casa de 64 años que inició su propio negocio en su hogar, un almacén misceláneo con un variado surtido de papelería, juguetes, accesorios y detalles para toda ocasión, también comercializa gaseosas, cervezas, confites y mecatos a los visitantes del negocio.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad a quienes sostuvo con las utilidades de su negocio porque siendo madre soltera no contó con una pareja que le apoyara con los gastos, hoy en día este sigue siendo su única forma para generar ingresos y cuenta con el apoyo que le brindan sus hijos.  Judith ella es muy dedicada y a pesar de su avanzada edad, sigue enérgica, carismática y diariamente abre su negocio en el que promueve ventas. Para ampliar su surtido está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en canastas de cervezas, accesorios y mecatos.  Con esta inversión podrá comprar de contado y obtener descuentos.  Su meta es ampliar el negocio  construir la segunda planta de su casa.
texts.en:
Judith is a 64 year old housewife who started her own business in her home, a small store with a variety of merchandise including paper, toys, accessories and small gifts for every occasion. She also sells carbonated drinks, beer, candy and pastries to those that visit her store.

She is the mother of four older children which she has supported with the profits form her business because, being a single mother, she couldn't count on a parter to help her with their expenses. Even today, her business is her only way of generating income and she relies on the support that her children offer her. Judith is very dedicated and despite her old age she is still energetic and charismatic and opens her store daily to promote sales.

To expand her merchandise she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which she will invest in baskets of beer, accessories and pastries. With this investment she will be able to pay in cash and get a discount. Her goal is to expand her store and construct the second floor of her house.

loans.use: to invest in baskets of beer, accessories and pastries.

loans.name: Deonilda Leonor

texts.es: Deonilda es una mujer trabajadora de 50 años de edad, vive en la localidad rural de El Arenal, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a trabajos múltiples, como peonaje agrícola y cultivo de ajo orgánico. Solicita el micro crédito para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de ajo, es decir para comprar abono orgánico y para pagar a las personas que le ayudaran a darle mantenimiento. Deonilda espera en un futuro no muy lejano poder mejorar su casa para poder vivir cómodamente.
texts.en: Deonilda is a hard-working woman, 50 years old, who lives in a rural locale of El Arenal, which is located in Arequipa. She works at various jobs, such as an agricultural laborer and growing organic garlic. She asks for a microloan to be able to maintain her garlic crop, which is to say to purchase organic manure and to pay the people who help her maintain it. Deonilda hopes in the not-very-distant future to be able to improve her house to be able to live comfortably.

loans.use: to maintain her organic garlic crops.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia cuenta con 39 años de edad de los cuales tiene 18  de dedicarse a la venta de mariscos y almuerzos a la orilla de la playa, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, además cuenta con una lancha en la cual extraer mariscos que luego vende con las vendedoras de comida de la playa. Cecilia es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 4 años de edad al que saca adelante, con mucho esfuerzo. Cecilia desea invertir en mayor cantidad de mariscos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camarones, langostas y conchas para su negocio de venta de comida y cócteles.
texts.en: Cecilia is 39 years old, of which she has been working selling shellfish and lunches at the edge of the beach for 18, which allows her to sustain the household economy. In addition she has a boat with which to harvest shellfish which she later sells with the food sellers on the beach. Cecilia is a single mother and lives with her 4-year-old son who she gets ahead with a lot of effort. Cecilia wants to invest in a greater quantity of shellfish, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in shrimp, lobster and shellfish for her business selling food and cocktails.

loans.use: to invest in shrimp, lobster, and shellfish for her business selling food and cocktails.

loans.name: Inkerebutsi Group

texts.fr:
Richard  fait partie du groupe  Inkerebutsi et  habite à  Muramvya. Il a 29 ans et est marié à Honoratte, une cultivatrice. 
 
Il fait le commerce de  riz, haricot,...et fait l'élevage du petit bétail depuis  4 ans. 

Il  est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à revendre  dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une voiture, construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Richard is a member of the Inkerebutsi Group and lives in Muramvya. He is 29 years old and married to Honoratte, a farmer.

He has been earning a living through selling rice and beans and raising livestock for four years.

This will be his third loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will be able to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans which will be resold out of his store in order to earn a profit.

In the years to come, he would like to purchase a car and build himself a beautiful home.

loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase a large quantity of rice and beans which will be resold out of their store in order to earn a profit.

loans.name: Guapay Group

texts.es:
Mariela es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 8 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de cuñapés. 
Ella es buena madre, constante e independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘puerto pailas’ distante a 45 kilómetros de la ciudad, área rural que acopia la producción frutera del lugar.
Mariela es trigueña de cabello castaño y baja estatura (la primera de la derecha, viste polera blanca cuello rojo), su lengua materna es al Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta sólo  con energía eléctrica. La ganas de mejorar su negocio la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; confección de sombreros de sao, venta de frutas, venta de huevo, artesanía en cuero, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de comida y taller eléctrico. Su negocio es la venta de cuñapé; estos son pequeños bollos a base de almidón de yuca y leche, son muy populares entre propios y visitantes, “vendo cuñapé porque se pueden comer a media mañana y por las tardes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de harina de yuca por quintal y otros insumos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y un cuarto donde poder hornear cuñapé. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Mariela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para hornear cuñapé y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mariela is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her partner, has 3 children, ages 1, 8 and 12, and her business is selling cuñapés [rolls made with milk and yucca flour].

She is a good mother, persevering and independent. Her business is located in Puerto Pailas, 45 kilometers from the city, a rural area which joins the fruit production of the place.

Mariela is olive-skinned, has brown hair and is short (she is the first on the right, wearing a white shirt with a red collar), her native language is Guaraní ans she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver, and with her children who go to school. They live in their own house built of wood that only has electricity. The desire to improve her business made her form a bank with people with businesses such as making straw hats, selling fruits, selling eggs, leather crafts, selling second-hand clothing, selling food, and an electrical shop. Her business is selling cuñapés, these are small rolls made from yucca starch and milk. They are very popular among locals and visitors. "I sell cuñapés because one can eat them at mid-morning and in the afternoons..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase yucca flour by the quintal and other supplies. Her dream is to have her own house and a room where she can bake cuñapés. this is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years she has done this work.

For these reasons, Mariela asks for a loan to purchase ingredients to bake cuñapés and improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients to bake cuñapés [rolls made with milk and yucca flour] and improve her sales.

loans.name: Ana Olivia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 24 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Ana es madre soltera y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 6 años y un varón de 4 años de edad a los que saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo, además por las tardes vende platos típicos, como papas fritas, tostadas de plátano y yuca. Ana desea surtir más su negocio de venta de ropa, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, camisetas, entre otros productos solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a 24 year old woman who makes a living selling pieces of clothing, which lets her support her household economically. Ana is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two children, a 6 year old girl and a 4 year old boy, with whom she manages to get by with much effort.

Furthermore, in the afternoon she sells typical dishes such as fried potatoes and tostadas made from yucca and plantains. Ana wants to stock her clothing business more, which is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan so she can invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts and t-shirts as well as other products asked for by her clients.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts and t-shirts as well as other products asked for by her clients.

loans.name: Ruma

texts.en:
Ruma is a 27-year-old woman who lives in a remote village of Falakata in West Bengal. She is married to Indramohan. She is a mother of a 2-year-old girl.

Ruma’s husband is an enterprising man who is engaged in a business of selling medicine from his shop. Being a housewife, Ruma also helps her husband in this business after managing her household work.

Medicine has a very good demand in their area, as in their locality medicines shops are very far away. Her husband needs to develop his stocks of medicines, but they do not have sufficient capital to invest in the business.

Thus Ruma is requesting the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase more medicines from the drug wholesalers. She hopes this loan will give a boost to their business and attract more customers.

Her dream is to expand the business in order to strengthen the family's economy. She is grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for their business.

loans.name: Mausumi

texts.en:
Mausumi, 26, is an enthusiastic woman from the small village of Kandi, West Bengal. She is a housewife and her husband is engaged in an iron grill manufacturing business.

They have a workshop with a lathe machine. They manufacture iron grills and sell them to their neighbors and villagers as well as in the market as per their customers' demands. Her husband has been involved in this business for three years. He has chosen this business as it is profitable and there are very few grill shops in the village.

With their present economic situation when prices of essential commodities are increasing daily, the couple decided to expand their business. Thus, Mausumi has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).

She will use the loan money to purchase bulk of raw materials such as iron rods, colors, etc. from the wholesale market. She and her husband hope it will improve their business and they can satisfy the demand of their customers.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase iron and necessary materials for her husband's grill manufacturing business.

loans.name: Jesus Mario

texts.es:
Jesús, de 70 años de edad, no tuvo la dicha de estudiar porque la escuela le quedaba muy lejos, por eso se dedicó a trabajar con su padre, está acompañado y junto a su pareja tienen tres hijas de 27, 24 y 20 años de edad, peor solamente la menor estudia y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido del hogar.

Jesús, es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, desde muy pequeño ayudaba a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas; hoy en día tiene sembradas 14,000 metros cuadrados de jícama y además 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, de esa manera tiene ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
