La inversión de este préstamo será destinada para comprar abono y para pagar mozos y alquilar el tractor para arar la tierra, de todo eso obtendrá más ganancias y podrá seguir trabajando.

Jesús, sueña con ver a su hija graduada de una carrera universitaria, para que se pueda desempeñar en el ámbito laboral y tenga una vida mejor.-
texts.en:
Jesús is 70-years old. He did not have the good fortune of studying because the school was located very far away, so he began working with his father. He is married and he and his wife have 3 daughters who are 27, 24, and 20-years old. The youngest is in school. His wife works in chores and home care.

Jesús is a very hard-working person who works in agriculture. From a young age he was helping his father with the farm work. Now he has 14,000 square meters of jicama and 14,000 square meters of corn and 14,000 square meters of beans planted. This way he will have an income to support his family.

The investment of this loan will be used to buy fertilizer, to pay workers and to rent a tractor to plow the land. From all of this, he will get more earnings and will be able to continue working. Jesús dreams of seeing his daughter graduated with a college degree so that she can perform in the work environment and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay workers and rent a tractor to plow the land.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es: Doña Erminia tiene su propia tienda en la cual vende abarrotes a sus clientes.Solicita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares ($250), para poder comprar mercadería y poder ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de productos, de esta manera incrementará las ventas y mejorará los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en: Erminia has her own store where she sells grocery store items to her customers. She is asking for a loan of two-hundred and fifty dollars ($250) to be able to buy merchandise and offer her customers a variety of products. This way she will increase her sales and improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is a 30-year-old rural woman from a small village of Kandi. She lives there with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter reads in grade 6 and son is below school-going age. Aparna and her husband are engaged in making decorative items.

Together the couple makes various decorative items, flex, photo frames etc. made of thermocol (polystyrene foam) and other decorative materials to earn their livelihood. They purchase thermocols and other decorative materials from the wholesale market and make various decorative items for different occasions like marriage ceremonies, birthday parties and other ceremonies as per the demand of their customers.

There is a great demand for their products in the region. As the festive season is knocking at the door, they need to buy sufficient materials to fulfill the demands of their customers. To achieve the same, she needs some capital. So Aparna applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy thermocols, glitters, colors, adhesive, etc. from the wholesale market for their business.

She hopes she will be able to make more fashionable decorative items to attract the customers. It will enable her to earn more and ensure the financial stability of her family for leading a decent life.

She and her husband thank their generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase thermocols and necessary materials for her decorating business.

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Mithu is 31 years old. She is married and a housewife. She studied up to grade 9. She is blessed with one son. Her son is studying in grade 2. They live in a remote region of Falakata in Alipurduar district.

Mithu's husband, Madan, is 38 years old and a farmer by profession. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers, eggplants, beans, etc. He grows quality products and the price of his products is also cheap. So the number of his customers is increasing gradually.

Now he wants to cultivate bottle gourd in his farmland because it has a huge demand in their locality for its nutritional benefits.

Thus Mithu is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy bottle gourd seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow bottle gourd. They hope they will get a good harvest for sale and with the profit they hope they can secure some savings for their future.

Mithu’s great desire is to build a concrete house with the profit in the future. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm inputs for bottle gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Fidelina De Jesus

texts.es: Fidelina cuenta con 27 años de edad y cada día muestra ser una mujer emprendedora que se despierta desde muy temprano para comprar fruta por mayoreo, la cual luego vende partida, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 3 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Fidelina vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 7 y 11 años de edad a las que apoya para que estudien. Fidelina desea invertir en una mayor cantidad de frutas por mayoreo  y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sandias, mango, pepino, melón, fresas, entre otros productos muy solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 27-years old and each day she proves to be an enterprising woman who wakes up very early to buy fruit wholesale and later sell it cut up. This has allowed her to support her family for the last 3 years. She has a large number of customers who seek her products.

Fidelina lives in a house on her property with her partner and 2 daughters, ages 7 and 11, who she supports so they can go to school. Fidelina wants to invest in a larger quantity of fruit at wholesale and this way improve her income. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy watermelon, mango, cucumber, melon, strawberries and other popular products.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, mango, cucumber, melon, strawberries and other popular products.

loans.name: Maria Uvence

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 25 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejors ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria is 44-years old and lives in her own home with her partner. She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for 25 years. Her business is located in the town market and has many customers. With her earnings she manages to resolve some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale to continue with her job and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Falani

texts.en:
Falani, 24, is a woman of courage and strength. She is married to Sanjit. They are blessed with one son, who is a toddler. They live in a small village of Falakata.

Falani's husband is a farmer whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Falani runs her own cattle rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. She also sells cattle by-products like cow dung, which is used as fertilizer in the remote region for cultivation.

By running her own business, she is able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this young, ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling more milk and milk products.

Falani seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Falani will be able to expand her existing business again.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 42-year-old lady who lives in a small village of Falakata. She is a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Her daughter is married now and her son is involved a mixture business.

She is a housewife and her husband is a cycle rickshaw puller by profession. He gives transportation service to the local people. A cycle rickshaw is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry people from one place to another. Her husband’s rickshaw is rented from a local owner. It doesn’t provide a sufficient income for the family, so he wants to purchase a cycle rickshaw of his own. But money is the main problem.

So, as a responsible wife, Shikha came forward and applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. With this loan money she will buy a cycle rickshaw for her husband’s transportation business.

She is very much thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti, age 30, is married to Kamal and she is a mother of a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in West Altagram Village in Dhupguri. Her son is a student of kindergarten and her daughter is just 3 months old.

Suniti studied up to grade 10. Now Suniti is a housewife and all day she usually is busy with her household work and taking care of her children and husband.

Suniti’s husband runs a decorator business. He supplies clothes, bamboos, bedding, etc. for different occasions and festivals for hire to his villagers. Their income depends upon the rate they charge for their decorative items.

But now the rent they get is not enough for them to run a family. They need to expand their business, since the festival season is knocking at the door, and it helps them to rent more to customers. But their savings is not sufficient to purchase adequate stocks for this business.

That is why Suniti needs the loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy more decorating clothes, bamboos, bedding and many other things to run the decorator business smoothly. She thinks that the profit she will obtain from their business will improve her financial condition and their standard of living.

Suniti sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase decorating clothes and different kinds of necessary equipment for her pandal business (decorator business).

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a very active lady of 23 years. She lives with her husband and three daughters in the small village of Dhupguri, West Bengal. She studied till 6th grade and she got married at a very young age.  Now she is a homemaker. 

To make a living for the family, Anita's husband has been engaged in farming activities. He mainly cultivates rice and vegetables on his piece of land. He has been doing this for five years. Anita also helps her husband in agricultural work after managing her household jobs. They sell the harvest product from their agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide themselves with clothing, food, medicine etc. 

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating more paddies. Being a staple food of west Bengal, paddy rice is in great demand in their locality and is widely used in India. Thus, Anita applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, other agricultural inputs and to bear the operational cost for paddy cultivation. 

Her goal is to continue increasing the cultivation of the product and strengthening her family's economy. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and to bear the operational cost for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Taramani

texts.en:
Taramani is from the village Jogendrapur of Falakata in the Alipurduar district. Her family consists of her husband and her three children. She is a 25-year-old housewife who studied up to grade 6. Her two sons are studying in different grades and her daughter is a toddler. 

Taramani’s husband, Sukumar, is involved in farming. This is an important source of income for them. He grows vegetables and sells the produce in the local market. The low income is not enough to meet the basic needs of their family, and they can barely manage household expenses.

As life gets more expensive day by day, Taramani and her husband want to grow their income. They want to cultivate eggplant, which is a popular vegetable with a great nutritious value. But they need capital to purchase farm supplies for eggplant cultivation.

So Taramani is seeking a loan from Kiva and BJS for purchasing good quality seeds and fertilizer of eggplant to cultivate and run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the household expenses. She wants to give her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can upgrade their living standard. 

Taramani is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Mamuni

texts.en:
Mamuni is a married woman of 26. She is blessed with two sons. One of her sons is studying in grade 1 and the other one is just a 2-year-old child. She lives with her husband and sons in their own small house in a small village of Dhupguri in West Bengal.
  
Mamuni’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they think of cultivating a crop which is profitable and which is a year-round crop. So they have decided to grow paddy rice on their farmland. But they do not have adequate capital to invest in their business, so they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Mamuni has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and the requested loan is very important for Mamuni to be able to purchase fertilizers, seeds and to bear the additional operational cost for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams to expand their agribusiness in the future.

She is thankful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and to bear the additional operational cost for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: José Joaquin

texts.es: José es un microempresario que se encuentra domiciliado en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo menor de edad, éste emprendedor hombre de 33 años es herrero innato; aprendió este arte gracias a un herrero experimentado quien le permitió involucrarse en el proceso productivo de ornamentaciones en su taller y ser su ayudante. Posteriormente trabajó con una refinería de petróleo en donde logró ahorrar una suma de dinero que le permitió aperturar su propio taller de ornamentaciones en donde cuenta con una amplia experiencia que le permite realizar productos de calidad con su toque personal. Los servicios de diseño y elaboración de cerramientos en hierro para terrazas, ventanas, puertas, entre otras estructuras, los propone a sus clientes a través de su propio catálogo que contiene fotografías de trabajos de su autoría, su local está ubicado en su vivienda en donde sus clientes llegan y también a domicilio les ofrece servicio de cotización bajo medidas. En la actualidad su capital le es insuficiente para cumplir con la demanda, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materia primas e insumos y herramientas; taladro y comprensor. Con esta inversión podrá contar con la maquinaria necesaria y sus servicios serán mucho más ágiles.
texts.en:
José is a small-business owner established in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias with his wife and young son. This enterprising 33-year-old man is a natural blacksmith; he learned this trade thanks to an experienced blacksmith who allowed him to take part in the ornamental production process in his workshop and become his assistant.

Previously José worked in an oil refinery where he was able to save a sum of money which he used to open his own ornamental workshop. José's experience as a blacksmith means he is able to produce quality products with a personal touch.

Design services and the production of ironwork for terraces, windows, gates and other structures are offered to customers through José's own catalogue which contains photos of his work. His workshop is located in his home and the customers can visit the workshop and José also offers a service where he visits the customer's home to take measurements and provide quotes.

Right now José's capital is insufficient to keep up with demand, thus he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy primary materials, supplies and tools, a drill and a compressor. With this investment José will have the machinery necessary to be able to offer a full range of services.

loans.use: to buy primary materials, supplies and tools, a drill and a compressor.

loans.name: Jazzillah

texts.en:
Jazzillah is a 32-year-old married woman with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling general merchandise but also gets other income from teaching and a motorcycle transport business. With her ambition of becoming a head teacher, Jazzillah is pursuing a masters degree and requests for a loan to help her in paying school fees.

Jazzilah is grateful to kiva for funds for the previous loan she got because it helped her so much to buy another motorcycle and start her studies.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 56-year-old farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a widow who primarily grows rice for an income for many years now. Aside from farming, she is also engaged in hog raising, baking bread and cooking pancake for additional income. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, margarine, cooking oil and flour. Part of the income will go towards the education of her youngest who is seventeen years old. She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her business profit and the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, margarine, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a 57-year-old farmer from the town of  Trinidad, Bohol.  She grows bitter gourd for an income. She is married with six grown children. She is asking for a  loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. She enjoys what she is doing and she works hard so that she can have a better return on her investment.  She hopes that someday she can improve her farm and expand the types of vegetables that she can grow for a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Teofanisa

texts.en: Teofanisa is a 48-year-old farmer from the town of  Trinidad, Bohol.  She grows rice to earn an income. She also sells dried fish and raises hogs for additional profit. Teofanisa is motivated to work her best so her children ages 14, 16 and 18 can have a better future. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, feed and more dried fish that she can sell. She hopes that someday she can have a stable business with reliable income so that her family can have a good life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and more dried fish

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She engages in buying and selling of scrap materials like iron, mineral water bottles, cans, galvanized iron, and many others. She has been buying and selling scrap materials for many years now. Rina is asking for a loan to buy a variety of scrap materials like plastic water bottles, a piece of iron, and many others. This will augment her income, thus helping her family to have abundant food and good living conditions. Rina hopes that with an additional capital she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of scrap materials like plastic water bottles, a piece of iron, and many others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle (taxi) and thus be able to support her family and be able to get ahead and have a better life.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is a rural, hardworking woman of only 31 years. She is married to Ranjit, a 40-year-old farmer. They live in Raychenga, a small village of Falakata in Alipurduar district, West Bengal, India. They are blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is studying in grade 9 and her daughter is a toddler.

Dipa’s husband is a very hardworking man. He cultivates on his farm land, mainly paddy rice because he has a lot of knowledge about its production and always offers quality products. He supplies his paddy rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market.

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Dipa is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing more paddy fertilizers, pesticides, and good quality seeds, and to cover the operational costs of paddy cultivation. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

With this investment, at the end of the harvest, he will be able to have a better production, and with his earnings, he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

Dipa is very thankful for Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una ama de casa que inició su negocio con el propósito de mejorar los ingresos familiares, ella reside en un barrio de Cartagena en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos y encontró en la elaboración de productos congelados y la comercialización de mercancías varias una oportunidad de negocio pues es una encantadora mujer que tiene una gran base de conocidos; vecinos, amigos y familiares. Alterno a esta actividad ofrece  productos por intermedio de catálogos especializados que promueve entre su clientela cada vez que encuentra la oportunidad, su éxito es debido a su entrega y dedicación, ella después de cumplir con sus deberes en el hogar, todos los días está dispuesta para sus clientes a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en prendas de vestir y calzado que sus clientes le han solicitado y en materias primas para la producción de sus productos congelados; harina, queso, vitina, mantequilla y carnes.  Con esta inversión podrá responder a sus pedidos y continuará ofreciéndole bienestar a su familia. Su meta a futuro es adecuar un local comercial y realizarle adecuaciones locativas a su vivienda.
texts.en: Guadalupe is a homemaker who started her business with the purpose of improving her family's income. She lives in a neighborhood of Cartagena along with her spouse and their two children and found in making frozen products and selling various merchandise a business opportunity. She is a lovely woman who has a large customer base of neighbors, friends and family members. As well as this work, she offers products from specialized catalogs which she promotes among her customers each time she finds the opportunity. Her success is due to her delivery and dedication. After completing her housework, she is available to her customers every day from 8AM until 9PM. Currently, she is applying for her first CrediKiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in clothing and shoes that her customers have requested from her and in raw materials to make her frozen products: flour, cheese, margarine, butter and meat. With this investment, she will be able to meet the orders and continue offering wellbeing to her family. Her goal in the future is to rent a store and to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and shoes and in raw materials to produce her frozen products such as flour, cheese, margarine, butter and meat.

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Mithu is 28 years old and a young woman entrepreneur who has a strong determination to contribute to her family and to educate enough of her three daughters. That spirit gives Mithu a new inspiration to exist in a better manner in her daily life.

Her family tries hard to survive in the fittest way, and her husband is engaged with some income-generating work. There has been always a chance of uncertainty present in every day.

Mithu has run her own dairy business for the last two years. Now she wants to expand her dairy business by purchasing another cow that gives her the opportunity to produce more milk and earn sufficient money, which may secure not only her future but also her family’s future.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS for expanding her existing business. With the loan amount Mithu will be able to purchase a cow, which will increase the quantity of milk and may enhance the capacity of earning money for her.

Mithu gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for considering her capability and courage.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Rupabati

texts.en:
Rupabati hails from Falakata. She is 41 years old, married, and a housewife. She and her husband, Sharat, together are raising two daughters. Her one daughter is pursuing a graduate degree and another one is studying in grade 11.

The dynamic and hardworking husband of Rupabati is running a business of growing seasonal vegetables. Though a housewife, Rupabati helps her husband, especially at the time of harvesting and selling their products to the local markets.

Due to the seasonal nature of his job, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household. Now they have decided to cultivate paddy (rice) in their farmland. With the addition of the cultivation of paddy, he will be able to increase his monthly income, as paddy is a staple food in West Bengal — it is an all-season crop and has a high demand in the market. They need to purchase necessary agricultural supplies for paddy but lacks the funds.

In order to help her husband, Rupabati has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to start cultivation. The loan will help Rupabati to keep her family afloat with a stable economy. She dreams to purchase more farmland in the future with the profit of the business.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: to purchase good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 33-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and their two sons; both of them are studying in different grades in school. They live in a small village of Kandi in Murshidabad district, West Bengal. Her husband is a van puller by profession.

To supplement her husband’s income, Namita runs a grocery shop which sells essential commodities of everyday needs like rice, oil, salt, sugar, flour, biscuits, eggs and fresh vegetables. Namita runs this shop after managing her household work.

Besides aspiring to provide their sons a good education, Namita also hopes to save enough and access better living conditions. To that end, she works hard and saves diligently from her earnings by carefully managing their expenses.

To generate more income, Namita wants to expand her business by adding more items in her inventory to sell. To stock and store this inventory, she needs financial help. She requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in these purchases.

With the expansion, her income has been projected to increase substantially. She will also have the option of reinvesting these savings in her business for further growth, and the improved income and savings.

She thanks her lenders because their loan will take a hardworking young mother and her family a step closer to achieving their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
54-year-old Victoria is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and all her children are already adults.

Victoria operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sell basic household needs like sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, rice, seasoning, and toiletries. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for ten years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy canned foods, soft drinks, liquor, chips, oil and sugar. With these, she could attract more customers and would definitely increase her sales. Victoria hopes that she can expand her sari-sari (variety) store business with the additional capital for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned foods, soft drinks, liquor, chips, oil and sugar

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 45 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Evangeline has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of oysters to sell to her local market.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of oysters to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virginita is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Virginita has a rug making business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy used garments for her business and other supplies.

Virginita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Virginita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy used garments and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sudha

texts.en:
Sudha is a 24-year-old, married woman from Kandi. She is illiterate but can sign her name only. She is married to Sanjay, who is a farmer by profession. His income is varying. This couple is blessed with two sons. Her sons are studying in different grades in a local village school.

To give financial support to her family, Sudha runs her own dairy business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. She also makes and sells cow dung firewood sticks for additional income to her fellow villagers.

Now she wants to expand her business. An additional cow will grow her asset base and increase her income through milk production. The cow will also help in getting more cow dung.

With the aim to satisfy her customers’ demands, Sudha seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a new cow. With the expansion of the business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Sudha wants to strengthen the family economy and dreams to build a concrete house for her family’s well-being.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is a 60-year-old married woman with two adult children. She and her family reside in San Miguel, Bohol. To earn an income she runs a sari-sari store (variety store). She sells slippers, canned food, soft drinks, seasoning, and bread. She is asking for a loan to buy slippers, three boxes of canned goods, one sack of sugar, and two sacks of rice. She hopes that she can increase her income from the increased inventory. Apolonia dreams of having more business someday so she can improve the living conditions of her family. She also wants to help other people.

loans.use: to buy slippers, three boxes of canned goods, one sack of sugar, and two sacks of rice.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman, 50 years old, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elsa has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap, beauty kits, and other personal care products.

Elsa has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap, beauty kits, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo de 37  años vive en la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras, él se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos y agricultura de granos básicos desde hace 15 años, uno de sus objetivos por cumplir es  ver a  sus hijos graduarse y ser personas de bien en el futuro. Sin embargo hay un obstáculo que le impide a Domingo que su familia tenga una mejor calidad como él quisiera y es la falta de energía eléctrica, ya que en la comunidad donde vive, no cuentan con este servicio. Él sabe muy bien que al tener acceso a iluminación su familia tendría una mejor condición de vida,  ya que esto les beneficiaria mucho, porque ya  no tendrían que iluminarse con velas y lámparas de querosén perjudicando su salud y sobre todo a la hora en que sus hijos deben hacer las tareas, asimismo le ayudaría con el ahorro por la carga de teléfonos celulares. Por todo esto Domingo solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar que le  brindara a su familia las condiciones básicas adecuadas para poder vivir.
texts.en: Domingo, who is 37 years old, lives in the community of Atlantida, Honduras.  He has worked raising pigs and growing staple foods for the past 15 years.  One of his goals is to see hes children graduate and become people of goodwill in the future. However, there is one obstacle that impedes Domingo from giving his family the better quality of life that desires and that is the lack of electricity, since in the community where he lives, they do  not have this service.  He knows very well that having access to light would give his family a better quality of life, since this would benefit them a lot, because they wouldn't have to light their home with candles and kerosene lamps, which are harmful to their health, and especially at the time where their children have to do their homework.  Also, this would help them save on charging their cell phones. For these reasons, Domingo is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras to acquire a solar energy system that will offer his family adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for illumination that will help him improve the living conditions of his home.

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en: Pompia is an entrepreneur from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a 65-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown children. Pompia needs a loan to buy items in bulk for her store, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda, cooking seasonings, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and serve more buyers in her store, increasing her sales and profit. In the future, Pompia hopes to buy more merchandise that she has not previously offered to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, rice, soda, cooking seasonings, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 53, is a farmer. She works hard daily on her farm, where she grows rice. She also prepares and sells home-cooked snacks, such as rice cakes. 

Victoria has two children, ages 15 and 17, and she wants to improve her food vending business in order to better provide for them. She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services, and she requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000. She will use her loan funds to buy sticky rice and sugar, which she will use to prepare snack items to offer for sale. 

With the expected profits, she intends to cover her household expenses and take care of her children.

loans.use: to  buy sticky rice and sugar for making homemade snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She also sells home-cooked dishes, fruits, and vegetables. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years. This is the source of her income. Flordeliza is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of rice, fruits and vegetables. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store as well as her sales and profit. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to make her business successful and more sustainable. Any income will be for her dependents ages 12 and 16.

loans.use: to buy rice, fruits and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma is a married woman with six children. Gelma is 47 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gelma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Gelma requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Gelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline, 30, is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. For six years, she has raised pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo de 41 años quien vive en Atlántida, Honduras es un agricultor de granos básicos y constructor de casas, con sus dos empleos busca darle lo mejor  a su familia formada por su esposa y cinco hijos. Una de sus mayores aspiraciones es poder  hacer  mejoras a su vivienda y así poder empezar con un pequeño negocio que le permitirá vender alimentos de consumo y generar más ingresos para la familia. En la comunidad donde vive Gonzalo no hay acceso a energía eléctrica por lo cual deben iluminarse con lámparas a base de querosén lo que les dificulta realizar sus deberes domésticos por las noches, ya que esposa debe preparar los alimentos con poca iluminación, su hijo que está en la escuela debe  hacer sus tareas también expuesto al humo toxico de las lámparas y él debe caminar largas distancias y pagar por el servicio de carga de celular. Todo esto se ha vuelto  muy complicado para Gonzalo, por esa razón ha decidido solicitar financiamiento a Soluz Honduras  para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayudará a resolver todos los inconvenientes que está sufriendo por la falta de  energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, 41, who lives in Atlántida, Honduras is a basic grain farmer and house builder. With his two jobs he seeks to give the best to his family, consisting of his wife and five children. One of his greatest ambitions is to be able to make improvements to his home and thus be able to start a small business that will allow him to sell food ready for consumption and generate more income for the family.

In the community where Gonzalo lives there is no access to electricity, for which they must get light from kerosene lamps. This makes it difficult to perform their domestic chores at night, since his wife has to prepare food with little lighting, his son who is in school must do his homework also exposed to the toxic smoke from the lamps, and Gonzalo must walk long distances and pay to charge his cellphone.

All of this has become very difficult for Gonzalo. For that reason he has decided to apply for funding from Soluz Honduras to acquire a solar energy system that will help him solve all the problems he is suffering from the lack of electricity.

loans.use: purchase a solar energy system that will become very useful in household activities.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina makes and sells baskets to earn her living. She earns an additional income from pig fattening. She and her husband have eight children, and she works very hard to support her family.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She requested a new loan through NWTF in the amount of PhP 7,000. She will use her loan funds to buy raw materials for her basket-making business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her basket-making business

loans.name: Ivy Anjelie

texts.en:
Ivy Anjelie, age 25, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in her business for four years. In her store, she sells such grocery items as canned goods, noodles, spices, snack foods, milk, and coffee. She also offers household goods like shampoo and soap.

Ivy Anjelie and her husband have a small child, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Jean Donné

texts.fr: Jean Donné est un brave père de famille de 38 ans. Il est marié et ils ont un enfant de 6 ans et qui est CP2. C'est un homme responsable, débrouillard et travailleur. Il a déjà pratiqué son activité durant son célibat. Il avait commencé à exercer ce métier en 2002. Il n'avait pas de point de vente fixe auparavant donc il était obligé de faire des portes à portes et des ventes mobiles. Actuellement, il a un bon emplacement et les ventes vont bien. Son souhait est de développer et améliorer davantage son activité pour qu'il puisse par conséquent améliorer ainsi le niveau de vie de sa famille. Il projette de construire sa propre maison car il en a marre de louer et d'être expulsé et de déménager de temps en temps. Il a déjà acquis un terrain.
texts.en:
Jean Donné is an honest family man who is 38 years old. He's married and has a six-year-old son who is in elementary school. He is a responsible, resourceful, hardworking man.

He had already had his business when he was single. He started this work in 2002. Previously, he did not have a stand-alone shop, so he had to do door-to-door and mobile sales. Currently, he has a nice location and his sales are good.

He hopes to develop and improve his business so that he can improve his family's standards of living. He hopes to build his own house because he no longer wishes to rent and to lose his apartment and need to move from time to time. He has already purchased land.

loans.use: to buy stamps, garbage bags, brooms, mops, dish towels, soap dishes, etc

loans.name: Japilen

texts.en:
Japilen, age 29, operates a pig fattening business to earn a living. She has been engaged in this enterprise for two years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She is the single mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Japilen requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita, age 46, is a rice farmer in Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have two children, and she works very hard to provide for them. 

With the goal of increasing her income so that she can raise her family's standard of living, Anecita requested a loan. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings. She will also use a portion of her loan funds to pay the school fees of her children. She will use her expected profit toward expansion of her farming business. 

In the future, she hopes to see her children enjoying a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizer and quality seedlings, as well as to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 52 years old and has one child. Lorie is married and her child is in school.

Lorie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorie requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorie has been in this business for four years, and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Lorie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ivy is 28 years old and her child is still in school.

Ivy has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Ivy requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Ivy has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 26 years old and married with two children. Her two children are currently in school, and Jonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Jonalyn has been in this business for three years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: beauty products and dairy produtcs to meet the demand that her clients request.

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en:
Neneta is a 60-year-old woman living in an island of Bien Unido in Bohol. To support herself, she engages in selling snacks like pancakes, rice cakes and deep-fried bananas. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour.

This business provides her the income that she needs like food. She dreams of improving her sales and profit so she can live in comfort, especially at her age.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is 60 years old, married and has two children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She works hard farming rice in order to buy the basic needs for her family. 

Gorginia requested a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for her farm. She wants to increase her income for her family’s benefit.  Any additional profit will go towards the expansion of her farming business. In the future, she hopes to see her children have a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maximiliano Alcides

texts.es: Maximiliano es un emprendedor que evidencio en su comunidad una falencia de tiendas de víveres en los alrededores de su barrio; todos sus vecinos, incluyéndose, debían caminar largos trayectos para comprar víveres de suma importancia para la canasta familiar, de este modo hace seis años, decidió convertirse en un tendero y proporcionarle a los habitantes del sector una tienda de víveres con cercanía a sus hogares que les proporcionara productos de calidad a buen precio. Él maneja un amplio horario para que sus clientes tengan la oportunidad de realizar sus compras de productos sin inconvenientes y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir surtido de víveres; legumbres, arroz, aceite, carne, pollo, entre otros con la finalidad de que sus clientes encuentren todo en un mismo lugar. Maximiliano desea tener un stock con el que pueda responder oportunamente a la demanda y su meta a largo plazo será ampliar el local.
texts.en: Maximiliano is an entrepreneur who noticed a shortage of provisions stores in the area  surrounding his neighbourhood.All of his neighbours had to walk long distances to buy   important family staple goods.So it was that six years ago he decided to become a shopkeeper and open a provisions store near their homes, selling quality products at a good price to local residents.His shop is open all hours making it convenient for his customers to do their shopping. He is applying for his first loan with Kiva through the Field Partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a selection of provisions; vegetables, rice, oil, meat, chicken among other things. This will allow his customers find everything they need in one place. Maximiliano wants to hold enough stock so that he can meet his customers needs in a timely fashion. His long term dream is to expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy a selection of provisions; vegetables, rice, oil, meat, chicken among other things.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 53 years old and married with five children. Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

Anecita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorelie is 54 years old.

Lorelie has a retail vegetable business in the Philippines. Lorelie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lorelie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia de 35 años es una mujer emprendedora que su sueño desde muy joven  fue tener su propio negocio, por lo cual siempre que tenía la oportunidad comercializaba algunos productos de manera informal;  al pasar el tiempo  decidió cristalizar su iniciativa empresarial y organizó en su lugar de residencia una pequeña miscelánea donde vende a los vecinos y transeúntes del sector prendas de vestir, accesorios, útiles escolares, papelería, utensilios plástico, entre otros. Ella está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para incrementar su inventario de productos como ropa, calzado y accesorios de mayor venta para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año. Su visión es mejorar día a día la imagen de su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yesenia, who is 35 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman, whose dream since she was young was to have her own business. This is why every time she had the opportunity she would sell some products in an informal way. As time went by, she decided to crystallize her entrepreneurial initiative and organized in her place of residence a small general store, where she sells to the neighbors and passersby of the area. She sells clothing garments, accessories, school supplies, stationery, plastic utensils, among others. She is processing her first credikiva through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, with the goal of obtaining the sufficient resources to increase her product inventory, such as clothing, shoes, and accessories at wholesale to take advantage of the end of year season. Her vision is to improve the image of her business every day, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Don Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
Marly es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la librería.
Ella es inteligente, paciente y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘don Lorenzo’ área semi rural caracterizada por acopiar la producción agrícola.
Marly es de baja estatura físico robusto y usa lentes de aumento (sentada al centro, viste blusa celeste). Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio de yuca, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica. La necesidad por mejorar su librería la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cuñapes, verdulería, frutería, venta de huevo, artesanía en cuero, venta de comida y venta de ropa de segunda mano. Su negocio es la venta de material de escritorio y servicio de fotocopias en su librería que atiende durante la semana en su casa, “compré una maquina fotocopiadora y necesito abastecer la librería…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la falta de competencia en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de escritorio para abastecer la librería. Su sueño es tener una librería completa, ella desea comprar material de escritorio para abastecer la librería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marly solicita un préstamo para comprar material de escritorio para abastecer su librería.
texts.en:
Marly is a fifty-five year old woman who is married and has two independent children. Her business is a bookstore. She is intelligent, patient, and very friendly. She carries out her business in the “Don Lorenzo” community, a semi-rural area characterized by agricultural production.

Marly is short, in good health, and wears glasses (she’s seated in the center wearing a sky-blue blouse). Her maternal language is Guarani, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her spouse who works in the yucca trade. They live in their own house made of brick which only has electricity.

The need to improve her bookstore led her to form a personal bank with other businesses that sell cuñapes, vegetables, fruits, eggs, leather crafts, meals, and second-hand clothing. She works during the week from home in her bookstore which sells office supplies and has a photocopy service. “I bought a photocopier, and I need to supply to bookstore,” she says.

The advantage of her business is the lack of competition in the area; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy office supplies to supply her bookstore. Her dream is to have a complete bookstore, and she wants to buy supplies for her store. This is the first cycle of loans with the institution and the first year that she started this work. It’s for these reasons Marly requests a loan to buy office supplies to supply her bookstore.

loans.use: to buy office supplies to supply her bookstore

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying a grill for chicken - a new business idea that promises to be very profitable.

loans.name: Vichet

texts.en: Vichet is 20 years old, single, and lives with his family at Chba Ampov Phnom Penh. Currently, Vichet is a student in Cambodia. He studies in field of English Literature. He is in his first semester of his second year. Now he needs money to pay for his school fees so he applied to Maxima.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Ana Rosalia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  el Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 71 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ana es una muy buena esposa y madre que siempre le gustado colaborar de alguna u otra forma para salir adelante, ella  realiza los créditos para que  su  esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene una tercena en la cual vende carne de res, pollo o chancho lo cual es lo que más vende, el arrienda un local en el centro de la ciudad lugar muy propicio para sus ventas ya que es donde muchas personas acuden a realizar sus compras, su marido  se desplaza a los campos a comprar los chanchos lugar donde compra más barato y que le permite ganar más, tiene más de 40 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia trabajando honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos, pollos y otra carne que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos salen adelante, ella agradece mucho a las personas que le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
In the citadel El Floron in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known since many years ago as the city of the royal tamarinds, the loan group Renacer meets every fifteen days.
In this place lives Ana, she is 71 years old, she is married and from this relationship she has seven children who are all adults and independent. Her husband is a retailer.
And is a very good wife and mother who has always liked to work in one way or another to get ahead. She does the loans so that her husband can use them in his business. He has a butcher's shop where he sells beef, chicken, or pork, which is what he sells the most. He rents outs a store in the center of the city, a very favorable place for his sales, as it is where many people go to do their shopping. Her husband goes to fields to buy pigs, where he can get them cheaper and which allows him to make more money. He has had this occupation for more than 40 years, with which he has helped his family get ahead working in an honest way.
This loan is to buy pigs, chickens, and other meats that he sells. She has been in the loan group from the beginning, and she likes it because thanks to the loan they can get ahead. She is grateful for the people who help with the loan. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chickens, and other meats.

loans.name: Alma Yaneth

texts.es: Alma tiene 26 años de edad y se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante, ya que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas y productos congelados, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con estos ingresos económicos. Alma vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 3 y 11 años de edad en casa de su propiedad. Alma desea ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos congelados a sus clientes, además su venta de tortillas cada día tiene mayor demanda, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en maíz por mayoreo y una refrigeradora más grande para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Alma is 26 years old and she makes an effort every day to get ahead. It has been six years now she has been working selling tortillas and frozen products and she is very happy to be able to count on these economic revenues. Alma lives together with her husband and her two children aged 3 and 11 years old in a house that she owns. Alma wants to offer a greater quantity of frozen products to her clients and also her tortilla sales have more demand each day. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn wholesale and a larger refrigerator to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in corn wholesale and a larger refrigerator to improve her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net, a fish box, and gasoline for her fishing business.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. Marilou earns more income from raising pigs.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of purchasing an additional fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, a fish box, and gasoline for her fishing business.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 31 years old and has two children. Charlyn is married and has two children are still in school.

Charlyn is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Charlyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Charlyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 53 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Alma has been in this business for six years.

In the future Alma would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 42 years old and married with six children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Phoebe has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are presently in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Josephine has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Jilyn

texts.en:
Jimross is 19 years old and is the second of three children in the family. His mother Jilyn supports the family through her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Jimross is studying for a bachelor of science and information technology and is currently on his second year of this four-year course.

Jilyn is borrowing 5,500 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2015-2016 school year.

Jimross plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is 47 years old and has one child.

Daria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Daria has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 38 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Emily has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Joydes

texts.en:
Joydes is 21 years old, single, and has one child. Joydes is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Joydes has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Judah

texts.en:
Judah is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judah is 33 years old and has three children who are still in school. Judah has a buy-and-sell household products business in the Philippines.

Judah requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more household products to sell to her customers.

Judah has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more household products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kristia Marie

texts.en:
Kristia Marie is a 21-year-old single woman with one child.

Kristia Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, snack foods, shampoo, soap, and other personal care products.

Kristia Marie has previously borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 1 year, and also earns an income from food vending.

Kristia Marie aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, snack foods, shampoo, soap, and other personal care products

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Agus, one of Ruma's agents. Agus lives in Depok, a suburban area located about one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his two children. Agus owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He is a hardworking man and his community sees him as a friendly and trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Agus needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart.

Agus’ goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Agus is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
Waralaxmi, about 23 years old, is a self-motivated active woman entrepreneur from Rayagada, in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a very hardworking lady standing third from left in the photo with her hand raised. She resides with her husband and a son of one year.

Waralaxmi has been running a grocery shop for the last five years. Her husband is also supporting her in the business. Initially, Waralaxmi started this business with a small investment of her own. When Mahashakti Foundation started working in her village, she motivated five other women entrepreneurs, formed a group named “Maa Samaleswari” and applied for a loan for the development of their businesses.

Now Waralaxmi’s income is about 8,500 INR per month, but it is not at all sufficient to meet the household expenses. So, for further development, she will take a loan. With this loan, she will purchase rice, oil, tea, sugar, detergent, soap, snacks, chocolates, potatoes, onions, etc. Waralaxmi hopes to construct a permanent cabin for her business and a good house for her family.

The other five members are running cloth store, diary, vegetable vending, leaf plate business, and fruits business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, tea, sugar, detergent, soap, snacks, chocolates, potatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Leonida requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Leonida has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is an active young man. He has his own business. Alexander produces sunflower seeds. He does roasting and packaging. He has two hired employees.

As a result of the previous loan, he increased income and bought an additional dryer for seeds. In future, Alexander plans to build a shop and hire more people.

Alexander is asking for a loan of 80,000 UAH to purchase sunflower seeds.

He hopes to get additional income and develop his business further.

loans.use: to purchase sunflower seeds for roasting and packaging

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 31 years old and married; she has three children, and two of them are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Liezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, noodles, soap and other personal care products.

Liezel has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, noodles, soap and other personal care products

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 25 years old and has two children. She is single and has two children who are presently in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Liezel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Liezel has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a nice young lady in her middle 20s. She is married and has two kids. Her husband works as a sales representative with a low income.

Iman wanted to do something in her free time at home, so she started a year ago a small retail business selling accessories and cosmetics. She got good feedback for the quality she chose, and then she decided to go on with the business.

Now she is applying for a loan to buy more products to sell and to do promotion for her business in her region. This loan will help Iman achieve her dreams and be a productive woman.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and to do promotion for her business

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea, 43, is a married mother of three dependent children who live in Battambang province.

Together with her husband, Thea has been growing rice and raising pigs for ten years. Sometimes, Thea also uses her free time to work for others for a fee to earn additional income. These businesses earn her about USD $13 per day to support her big family.

This is the first time that Thea has requested a loan from VisionFund. As the leader of a group, which consists of four members, she will use her loan to buy pig feed to nourish her piglets to grow healthily. She hopes to sell her pigs at a better price and be able to expand her business, thus improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to nourish her piglets to grow healthily in order to sell them at better prices and thus be able to expand her business.

loans.name: Alli

texts.en:
Alli is in his late 40s and is single with two children who are still in school. He has been selling scrappers for five years now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. Scrapers are things like can tins which have been thrown away, iron bars which have been thrown away, and out of use and things like board of a car which has been in the garage for years getting rusted. She takes her collections to a scrappers factory to be melted into something else. 

This will be Alli's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock of scrappers and he has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to pay rent for his scrappers' shop and to cover the household expenses. 

He will use this loan increase the number of scrappers for resale. He will be accountable for paying back his loan.

Alli dreams of building his own house.

loans.use: to increase his stock of scrappers for resale.

loans.name: Nelpha

texts.en: Nelpha of Aloran helps support her family through her charcoal-making business. She’s 48 years old and married with four children , 2 are married and 2 are single and she tries her best to earn on her own. For four years, she has managed this business and earns about 6,000 PHP per month. Now, she’s needs to pay for the labor cost in charcoal making. She joined recently and thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 6,000 PHP they provided to her. Nelpha desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost for charcoal making.

loans.name: Ketty Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Ketty, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  de 22, 17 y 14 años  de edad, dos de  ellos estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en el extranjero.
Doña Ketty es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante a base de su trabajo y así ganarse lo suyo para los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella, para esto ella vende ropa y productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Ella también prepara almuerzos  para entregar, esto lo realiza de lunes a sábado los mismos que ella se encarga de entregar a domicilio, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad, ella agradece mucho a la fundación y las personas que siempre le ayudan para que ella reciba sus créditos. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que les ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Renacer" communal bank meets every fortnight in the El Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. It has been known as "the City of the Royal Tamarinds" for many years now.

Ketty lives in this place. She is 42 years old, is married and from this realtionship has three children aged 22, 17 and 14 years old. Two of them study in Secondary school. Her husband works abroad.

Ketty is a woman who like to get ahead through her work and thus make her own money for the household expenses and her children's studies which is most important to her. To do this she sells Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). Her form of selling is from door-to-door. She also prepares lunches to take out. She does this from Monday to Saturday and she takes care of the delivery to homes. She has done this business for more than ten years. She is very grateful to the Foundation and the people who always help her so that she receives her loans.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams and supplies to prepare her foods. She has been in the communal bank for seven years and she likes it for the services the institution provides. Her dream is to provide her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, creams and supplies.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Magdalina has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is sixty years old, married and has five children. For the past two years she has fattened and sold pigs to earn a living in the Philippines.

Leonita has taken out and successfully repaid two prior loans from Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional pig feed and a rice bran (rice shells for pigs food). She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pig feed and a rice barn.

loans.name: Loela

texts.en:
Loela is 30 years old and married, with one child.

Loela is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Loela requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Loela has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, age 22, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this enterprise for two years. In her store, she sells grocery items like canned goods, noodles, snack foods, spices, milk, and coffee. She also sells household goods like soap and shampoo. 

Liza and her husband have one child, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, age 31, operates a pig fattening business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this enterprise for two years, and she earns an additional income through food vending. 

She and her husband have four children, and she works hard to provide for her family.
