Marife requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Kisakye Group Kirinya Bweyogerere

texts.en:
Teddy is a repeat customer of UGAFODE Microfinance. She is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She is a married with three children.


Teddy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the town outskirts and requested a loan along with her group members through Kiva's partner UGAFODE Microfinance. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell such as rice, corn flour, spices, milk, cooking oil, beverages, etc.

She is an enterprising and industrious woman and has been running the grocery store for five years. She also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Teddy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college. She is in dire need of your kind help and will appreciate if given the support.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 40-years old married woman, lives with her husband and five children in the area of multan, Pakistan. Her son owns an electric repairing shop in which he sells generators to the people. He has been doing this work for many years. To carry out his work, he has to stay at shop to deal with the general public. He wants to buy the required electric material to cope with demand but due to high cost he is unable to purchase.

Therefore Asma demanded for a loan to support her son's business. She hopes that with loan amount her son will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time. Asma thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electric material for her son's electric shop

loans.name: Khamphaenamai Group

texts.en: Khamma’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khamma and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khamma and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khamma’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: terto purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking wa.

loans.name: Faraht

texts.en:
Faraht is a 40-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells fresh vegetables in his home town. He has been using four wheels manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop well. His children are growing and their needs as well, to cope with the rapid increase in the school fee, books, utility bills and household expenses. He wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Faraht has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy inventory in bulk for resale purpose for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Fishing is the main source of income in some community of Baybay, Leyte. Jocelyn and her husband are engaged in this business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 22 years. Aside from their catch, Jocelyn also buys more fish to sell. Jocelyn and her husband work hard to raise their six children. Her oldest school aged children is 20 years old while her youngest children is 10 years old.  She is asking a loan for boat maintenance and to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve their fishing business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Kobelo, who is in his mid-30's, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. He is also the leader of this two-member Machimbo Group.

Kobelo has been selling cereals like rice, wheat, beans, peas, etc. for seven years now. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Kobelo's ninth loan from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the amount of cereals he sells and managed to pay back his loans successfully. He was happy to receive these loans and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used his profits to pay school fees, repay his loan and build a house.

Kobelo has now applied for a 2,000,000 TZS loan to be divided between Modesta and himself, and they will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He will use his portion to buy more cereals and start selling them at wholesale prices. He dreams of being an international businessman.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and start selling them at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en:
Azatuhi is 45 years old and she lives with her daughter, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. She has vocational medical education and for 12 years she worked as a nurse at the local hospital. Now Azatuhi is a farmer and taking care of her farm cattle and land cultivation now is her main and the only occupation.

On her farm Azatuhi has cows, calves, heifers, sheep and a lot of chickens. Her farm products are of great demand as she makes very tasty cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and butter from her farm’s milk and she sells it to her regular customers from the village and city as well. On her plot of land, she cultivates potato and tomato and all these harvest with her farm meat and also eggs she sells and through it makes her family income and covers their everyday needs. With this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Azatuhi wants to make her farm richer with cattle and she wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, age 56, runs a general store to earn her living. She has operated her store for 35 years. In her store, she sells grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, spices, milk, and coffee. She also offers household goods like soap and shampoo. She earns an additional income by offering e-loading (phone card) services.

She and her husband have nine children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

Marilyn has borrowed and successfully repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store.

Marilyn aspires toward saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda is 38 years and married with five children out of which four go to school. He deals in cattle sales supplemented by milk, ghee sales and crop farming. He basically buys cattle fattens them to mature quickly and then sells at higher prices. This business has worked for him to raise family needs as well as educating his children. Like any other business person, Edward is challenged by problems of climatic weather changes like dry seasons where his animals lack enough water and pastures. He is a very hardworking man who loves his business and therefore he is requesting a loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer de 43 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia que es la razón por la cual se esmera y trabaja para darles lo mejor, ella cuenta que con el préstamo logro comprar más frutas y pudo satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes, ahora su negocio ha crecido y con ello sus ingresos mejoraron, con esta cambio Maria está satisfecha más no conforme es la razón que la motiva nuevamente para solicitar otro préstamo he invertirlo; con el préstamo ella comprar frutas como sandía, durazno, melón, papaya y piña. Con este nuevo anagrama Maria espera seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de los clientes. Su esperanza de vida es construir un local para brindar un mejor servicio a sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Maria is a 43-year-old woman who is married and has a lovely family. This is the reason why she works so hard, endeavoring to offer them the best. Maria says that with the new loan, she will be able to buy more fruit, enabling her to better satisfy her customers needs.

Maria's business has grown and, with that, her income has improved. She is happy about this change but not yet satisfied; she's now motivated to request another loan to invest.

With this loan, she will purchase more fruit including watermelons, peaches, papayas and pineapples. And with her new investment, Maria hopes to continue to satisfy her customers' needs.

Her goal in life is to construct her own store and offer better service to her consumers.

loans.use: purchase and sell fruits such as watermelons, peaches, melons, papayas, and pineapples.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 22 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Kiran has been running her own beauty salon for past 5 years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Kiran has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
For this financial assistance, Kiran is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Phupaman Group

texts.en: Korxong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Korxong and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Korxong and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Korxong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is 54 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Nageena has also been doing her business of cloth selling for past 6 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Nageena needs to buy different types of cloth for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy cloth for her business purpose, therefore She has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the cloth easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Nageena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to increase her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 33 year old Palestinian refugee who works as a construction painter. He is married and lives with his wife and four daughters in one of the Palestinian refugee camps located in the North of Lebanon. His wife is unemployed and his daughters all go to school inside the camp.

Ibrahim started working as a painter when he was 15 years old which gives him 18 years of successful experience and good reputation in the field. In order to buy new painting equipment and scaffold, Ibrahim decided to ask for a 1,799,994 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa for the first time. He believes that by getting this loan and buying the new equipment he will be able to take more projects. This increase in productivity is expected to boost his income which is much needed with the start of the school year.

loans.use: to buy painting equipment, to provide a better income to support his children's schooling

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine resides in Nairobi, Kenya, and is a single mother with a young child. She has been working for a social enterprise since March 2014, where she has been selling clean energy products to Kenyan households within Nairobi. Christine has provided over 500 fuel efficient cook stoves and solar lights to Kenyans, with financing provided by a local financial institution. She has simultaneously been pursuing a degree in business administration.

One of the main products Christine sells is the Burn jikokoa cookstove, which is a life saving stove that reduces charcoal use by 50% and also emits 60% less carbon emissions than a traditional cookstove, thus creating a healthier environment. Use of the jikokoa has resulted in extra cash flow for many families to pay school fees, pay off loans, and invest more in their businesses.

Christine plans to use the Kiva loan to purchase more Jikokoa cookstoves to sell within Nairobi, and to reach an additional 500 households before the end of the year. The loan will help Christine to raise business capital she would have been otherwise unable to raise, grow her business, and reach thousands of Kenyans. Not only will the loan benefit Christine’s business and family, but it will also improve the health of thousands of Kenyans, reduce impacts on the environment and allow families to save over $200 a year.

loans.use: to buy life saving stoves and sell them within her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils, basins

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en:
Devotha is in her early 40s and is married with three schooling children. She has been running a grocery store for ten years now. She works from 2 pm to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Devotha's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her drinks stock and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva.

Devotha used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to buy a plot of land, started building her house, and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy fast moving drinks in the grocery store and to start selling spirits. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Devotha will make sure she pays the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy  fast moving  drinks for the grocery store and to start selling spirits.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Elsa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Elsa has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik likes his first Kiva deal very much and he hopes that will have chance for second partnership. He lives in the village Norashenik of Syunik region. Here this farmer lives with his beloved wife who is unemployed and she greatly helps her husband in farming work. He used to work as a driver but now his main occupation is farming.

On his farm he has a cow, a calf, goats, chickens and also bee hives. His farm products assortment is milk, meat, cheese, butter, eggs and honey. On his plot of land Hrachik also cultivates potatoes which he sells to resellers.

If he manages to have orders, Hrachik also make cargo transfers on his own truck. Now with his second Kiva deal Harchik wants to enlarge his farm with more cattle and he plans to buy two heifers, also hay for his farm cattle and feed for his chickens.

loans.use: to enlarge his farm with more cattle and he plans to buy two heifers, also hay for his farm cattle and feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lolita has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a produce businessman trading in maize, waragi (distilled beverages) and dry cassava, a business that he established in 2008 so as to earn a living.

He now needs money to increase his stock of maize, waragi and dry cassava.

He is 23 years old, married and has no children. Robert is also doing boda boda (motorcycle transport) and farming as other sources of income.

Robert plans to extend his business to town; however, his challenge is lack of enough capital.

loans.use: to increase his stock of maize, waragi and dry cassava.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is an individual client from Kyamabugo in Sembabule. He is aged 27 years old, married with two children. He is a farmer majoring in the growing of coffee. He works eight hours per day. He would like a loan of two million to buy coffee trees and fertilizers. He is challenged by dry seasons. He appreciates UGAFODE support towards alleviating poverty in the rural communities.
In the photograph is Onesmus with the UGAFODE Credit officer(left to right).

loans.use: To buy farm in puts

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is an artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs.

Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"My childhood was spent appreciating nature beauty, like the Pacific Ocean with its colorful fish, blue waters, sand, rocks and sunsets. In the Andes, I came into contact with the culture of my ancestors, the Inca. Then I visited the Amazon rainforest. I began designing jewelry and then went on to craft everything I see in silver and precious stones. Some of my friends tell me I'm a dreamer. I tell them that the only way to create is first to dream."

"I'd like to take this opportunity to thank each of you for your support and for providing the incentive I needed to create new designs. I've been able to grow my business and grow as a person, which has driven me to feel great pride for my work and shine in the eyes of my family and community. I used to have a very humble workshop and very basic designs, and I feel I have come a very long way since then."
Use the link below to view Luis's handcrafted silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5549

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his designs

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married with children, and they are attending school. He deals in cereals produce business and farms as well. His family needs are met without tampering with his business capital. He is doing very well in his business which is proved by increased sales. However he also faces a challenge of price fluctuation.

Jackson tries to beat that problem by selling a variety, like rice, maize, beans, coffee, among others.He is also an innovative man, presently he has an idea of adding poultry and animal feeds, in his business. However, he has little money to meet that cost. He is requesting for money to buy poultry, and animal feed for selling. With that, there would be no reason for him not to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry and animal feed for selling.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is an entrepreneurial lady of 49 years. She is married and her family consists of her husband and one son. Her son is a student in grade 12. She lives with her son and husband in Kandi, Murshidabad district of West Bengal. Her husband is involved with a fish business.

Kabita has not lagged behind. With a lot of work and effort she runs a multi-gym which runs well in their locality.

Kabita was able to study up 10th grade and dropped out as her parents could not afford to support her further. Five years ago she decided to open a gym because she enjoys exercising and because there was no gym in her neighborhood with which she would compete.

Every day she is taking care of the clients, who come to exercise. She offers her clients affordable prices, a balanced fitness program and nutritional structure. It allows the members to gain strength, while offering a friendly, supportive environment. Kabita thinks that her clients are an inspiration to her every day.

Now she is requesting an enterprise loan from Kiva's partner BJS to remodel her gym which needs some improvement. She will purchase some modern equipment as per her customers' demands. The loan amount will make improvements to her gym and increase her earnings which she wants to utilize for the betterment of her family.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories for her gym centre.

loans.name: Kusumita

texts.en:
Kusumita is a 41-year-old hardworking lady who lives in Kandi in West Bengal. She is married and is a mother of one son and a daughter. Her son is involved with some income-generating work and her daughter is a student in grade 12.

She runs a micro-enterprise that sews attire like blouses, petticoats, salwars etc. and then she sells them to her regular customers and in the market. Her husband is engaged in the same business. Kusumita has been involved with this micro-business for last 5 years.

Now she desires to expand her business and wants to buy a modern sewing machine. This will ease her sewing work and attract more customers in the upcoming festive season.

To achieve this end she intends to take out a microloan from BJS (a Kiva partner), an organization that furthers and supports her enterprising efforts. The loan will help her to purchase a new and improved sewing machine and other accessories to help her continue her sewing work with greater efficiency. This will help her to increase her monthly earnings and provide a sense of financial security for her family.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 42 years old, hardworking woman who has 7 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Parveen’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Parveen has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN SEÑOR MAYOR QUE DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE RECURSOS NO SE HA ATENDIDO ALGUNOS PROBLEMAS DENTALES QUE PADECE. EN LA ACTUALIDAD SUFRE DE FUERTES DOLORES EN SUS MUELAS POR LO QUE BATALLA MUCHO PARA COMER, LE URGE UN TRATAMIENTO YA QUE EL DOLOR ES INSOPORTABLE Y EN OCASIONES HA TENIDO QUE DEJAR DE TRABAJAR.
texts.en:
He is an older man who, due to lack of resources, has not taken care of some dental problems that he has. He currently has severe gum pain, which makes it very hard for him to eat.

He urgently needs treatment because the pain is unbearable. He has sometimes had to leave work.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old and has five children. Sandra is a woman and has three children who are in school.

Sandra is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Sandra requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sandra has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush is 47 years old and he lives with his family is Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. His wife is unemployed, his daughter is already a student and his son temporally is in the Russian Federation.

Artush graduated Yerevan State Institute of Physical Education and started from 1993 he works at the school as teacher of Physical Education. Artush mentions that he likes his work very much and always having active way of life and thanks to his everyday physical exercises he feels healthy and great and the same are his pupils, whom he teaches and explains the importance of being physically educated.

Simultaneously Artush does farming in which he is also engaged with pleasure. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Artush asks as he wants to buy a computer and accessories for it, and on this way he will make a great surprise to his daughter, who being a student greatly needs a computer every day for her learning activities and entertainment as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer and accessories for his daughter's learning activities and entertainment as well.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is married and a mother of two. She has a silver jewellery shop. She also sells a herbal product named LR which she became acquainted this year. She and her husband used this product and got pleased with it, so she started selling it to her neighbours. Now she is actively selling it. With the help of the third loan she is planning to buy bulks of LR products. She aims to live a healthy life and wants her daughter to complete her education.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Perihan Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Gümüş takılar üzerine dükkanı var. Aynı zaman da bu sene tanıştığı LR adlı bitkisel ürün satışına başladı. Kendi ve eşi kullandıkdan sonra sağlık açısından faydalarını görünce etrafına satmaya başladı ve şuan aktif olarak bu işi de yapıyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile LR ürünü alacak. Sağlıklı bir şekilde hayatına devam etmek kızının eğitim hayatını tamamlamasını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy LR products

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is married with children. He operates a retail shop, and deals in vanilla business.He desires to have a bigger shop, and he is working very hard towards it. Edward wants to add  produce in his business, like rice and maize, so that he can earn more income. But the challenge is at the moment he does not have enough money to do so. He requests for money to buy bags of rice, maize flour and bags of millet flour for selling, then he repay back  the loan in installments without any failure.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, maize and millet flour for selling.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a 24-year-old woman married with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes to the people around her town and has been in business for four years. She is a hardworking lady having great hopes of expanding her business to also sell new clothes. Scovia faces hardships of competition and limited capital to meet all her personal and business expectations. She is requesting for a loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Kakoli

texts.en:
Kakoli is a young woman of 23 years from Kandi, West Bengal. She is married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Her son is in grade 2 and her daughter is in grade 1. She wants to educate her children properly. Her husband works in a small shop and is hardly able to earn a sufficient money to meet all the family's expenses.

The poor economic conditions of her household required Kakoli to do something for the sake of her family and she started her own milk supply business. She has been involved with this business for many years. She rears cows and sells the cow milk to her customers. For extra income she also sells cow dung which is a good farm manure and fuel for cooking. In order to expand her business, she needs to purchase one more dairy cow. But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Kakoli is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers. With this business, she will be able to earn more. So she has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to buy a cow. The loan will greatly help her to organize her business in more useful ways. Kakoli wants to help her husband economically and try to contribute in an effective way to educate her children properly.

She gives her heartfelt thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supplying business.

loans.name: Sunati

texts.en:
Sunati is a married woman of 33 years. She lives with her husband Nilkanta and two children in their own small house in a small village, Lotapota in Falakata. She is illiterate and can only sign her name, but her husband studied up to grade 6. Her children are studying in grades 12 and 9 respectively.

Sunati’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. After managing all her household work, Sunati assists her husband in his agricultural work. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop which is profitable and demanded in all season. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. As they have inadequate capital, they need some financial help. So Sunati has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

The requested loan amount will help Sunati to purchase fertilizer, good quality seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. It will greatly help this family to generate more income for the rest of the year. She dreams of expanding their agribusiness in future.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, good quality seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Amber

texts.en:
Amber is 28 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Amber has also been doing her business of clothes selling for the past 7 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Amber needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purposes. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Amber is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business by buying more items for sale to help support her family

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 30-year-old hardworking woman from Falakata. Her family is comprised of her husband and four children (one son and three daughters). Her two daughters are studying in school (grade 8 & 6) and others are toddlers. Her husband works outside of Falakata and she is engaged with a milk selling business.

To provide a better living, Arati has been engaged in cattle breeding and supplies milk to her neighbors to earn more for her family. She also sells cattle by-products like cow dung which is used as manure in the remote region for cultivation.

Now this business is a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she is able to generate more income. So she has decided to purchase one more cow and expand her business.

For this reason she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow and fodder in terms of getting more milk for sale. This will enable her to provide good education to her children and be able to expand her business with the increased profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Nakae Group

texts.en: Seenouan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Seenouan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Seenouan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Seenouan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Heuaykhayong Group

texts.en: Sangvone is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Sangvone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Sangvone and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Sangvone and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Sangvone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Bebi

texts.en:
A 26-year-old woman Bebi is a resident of Ruppur village in Kandi of West Bengal. She is a hardworking woman, who sweats to provide a good life to her family. She runs an animal husbandry and sells cow milk in her locality. She is married to Prabir who works as a deed writer in court. Together they are raising their one daughter, who studies in grade 6.

Bebi rears cows and sells their milk to the villagers, which is an important source of income for the family. Every morning, Bebi takes the cows to graze in the fields and returns by noon. This combined with the household work leaves her with absolutely no time for anything else, and yet she wants to expand her dairy business and invest more money in it.

She plans to buy a new milking cow and seeks a loan from Kiva via BJS for this purpose. She is confident about increasing her monthly income. She expects to secure her daughter’s future with proper education. This loan would help Bebi ease the financial stress at home.

Bebi expresses her gratitude to the generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is 27 years  married and has two children. To pay rent, she works in a grocery store. Her husband works in the public transportation business. Catalina needs a loan to buy more soft drinks for her business and also she realized she can sell more rice so she hopes you can help her Things are going well for Catalina but she wants to work hard because her husband told her that the family could have the chance to buy an apartment

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pans, utensils, and repairs for her food cart so that she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Maria Diosdada

texts.en: Maria Diosdada is a 67-year-old woman from Duero, Bohol. She has one adult daughter. Maria Diosdada's husband is a construction worker and she helped him by farming rice and buying and selling of harvested rice in her place. She act as a dealer of rice from farmers to wholesalers in their municipality as well. She is asking for a loan to buy additional sacks of rice  to sell in the market. She will also use the loan to buy fertilizer. With this, she will be able to sell more to the market thus augmenting her income and profit for their healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy more rice and fertilizer

loans.name: Robilla

texts.en: Robilla earns a living through her food vending business . She lives with her family in the town of Duero, Bohol. Robilla has been engaged in the business of food vending for seven years now. She sells home-cooked foods like deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar (banana cue), fried dough sprinkled with sugar (siakoy) and empanada (dough or bread with stuffing consisting of a variety of meat, cheese and vegetables) to the people in her place.  This is the source of her income. Robilla is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like banana, flour and cooking oil. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy banana, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 55 years old. He is married with 7 children. 

He has had a tailoring business which he has run for 26 years. 

He has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to purchase cloth material and hopes this will help him purchase a motorbike. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for sale to help him purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Merlita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is married with children. He owns a boutique and  is a very innovative business man. This is proved by the way he ventures in other businesses like cultivating crops and coffee business. Julius’ family never lacks anything due to his hard work that enables him to provide for them. His greatest desire is to own a bigger and modern boutique as he works hard towards achieving it. Of late, Julius wants to buy shoes and bags, because he seeing them more profitable, but however, he lacks some little money to meet his budget. He is requesting for money to buy bags and shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes for selling.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37 years old and has one child. Marilyn is married and has one child still in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married and a mother of three. She runs a small market in her neighbourhood. She also sells Tupperware products. She started selling LR products this month by her aunt's advice. With the help of the loan she is planning LR products in bulk. She aims to earn money to help the family budget and help her children to complete their education.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeynep hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Mahallesin de küçük bir bakkal dükkanı işletiyor. Aynı zaman da Tupperware ürünleri satıyor. Bu ay teyzesinin önerisi ile LR ürün satışını başladı. Aldığı kredi ile LR ürün alıp satacak. Amacı evine maddi kazanç sağlamak ve çocuklarını eğitimini tamamlamalarına yardımcı olmak.

loans.use: to buy LR products.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in wood carvings. She would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper, nails and polish.

Rita has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is her story:

As an artist, Rita proudly includes African themes into her designs. "Having a passion for creating more designs inspires me, and I have taught this art to a number of people. The basic materials I use are sese wood and aluminum sheets. My favorite things in life are cooking and being with my family. I dream that we'll one day have enough so I can also give back to others."

"Your assistance to me has really helped to give me a sustainable business. I really appreciate you and ask for God's blessings for you all. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Rita's wood carvings on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7110

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, sandpaper, nails and polish

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
33-year-old Shyamali lives in a small village called Bishwaspara in Kandi of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and one son. Her son is a student in grade 7 and her husband work in a sweetmeat shop. Shyamali works as a cook in a primary school. She prepares a mid-day meal for students and earns a nominal income. Additionally she is also engaged with her animal husbandry to generate extra income.

She buys goat kids from the wholesale market at a lower price and, after rearing, she sells them to the market at a profitable price. Now she wants to expand her business because the demand for goats is very high in her locality. So Shyamali applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more goat kids for her business. She expects a boost in her business and she wants to provide uninterrupted education to her son with the profit of her business.

She is very thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy more goat kids for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Madia

texts.en:
Madia is a 30-year-old lady, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she could provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a auto rickshaw from several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient amount to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Madia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to buy an auto rickshaw body.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN PADRE DE FAMILIA QUIEN ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA, LABORA EN ATENCIÓN AL PUBLICO. ACTUALMENTE SUFRE DE UN PROBLEMA DE EMPALMAMIENTO DE PIEZAS DENTALES LO QUE LE HA PROVOCADO ALTERACIÓN EN LA MANDÍBULA, APARTE DEL EVIDENTE PROBLEMA ESTÉTICO. LE URGE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA QUE DESGRACIADAMENTE LE RESULTA COSTOSO PARA SU ECONOMÍA.
texts.en:
He is a young father who is the sole support of his family. He works in public service.

He currently has an overlap problem with his teeth, which has caused a change in his jaw besides the obvious aesthetic problem. It is urgent that he receive orthodontic treatment, which is unfortunately very expensive for him.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Phonmouang Group

texts.en: Bounmee understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bounmee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounmee purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Bounmee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: terto purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking wa.

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya is a 39-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband and four children. Her husband represents the income source in the family in order to fulfill their family needs and improve their lifestyle. And as per her, she doesn’t work.

Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's study fees. What makes her very happy is that she will able to pursue their education suitably and secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Orencia

texts.en:
From Garcia Hernandez, Bohol, Orencia, a 53-year-old mother of six children has been raising pigs, growing tomatoes,  vegetables and act as vegetable dealer in her place. She work hard to support her children. This is her business for four years now. She has requested a loan of PHP9000 to buy feed, vegetables and fertilizer to sustain her business.
In the future, Orencia would like to expand to her enterprise so as to better provide for her three dependents, specially in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy feed, vegetables and fertilizer

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko from Sevan city of Gegharkunik region will be very happy, to have her third Kiva loan. Dariko works as a deputy director of the school. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her daughter is still student with the repayment of her tuition fee Kiva lenders already twice helped her. Her son lives abroad.

Dariko this time asks for her Kiva loan in order to buy a computer, accessories and also some professional literature of pedagogical methodology and she hopes that this time also she will receive financial support from the lenders, which will be of great use for her.

loans.use: to buy computer, accessories and also some professional literature of pedagogical methodology

loans.name: Sulpicio

texts.en:
Sulpicio earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He is 47 years old from Valencie, Bohol. He has been in the business for more 5 years now. Sulpicio is asking for a loan to buy spare tires, engine oil and pay for repair of his motorcyle.

With this, he will be able to serve more passengers and augment his daily income. Sulpicio dreams of exploring other ventures to increase his income and he wants to save money for old age.

loans.use: to buy spare tires, engine oil and pay for repair.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
This group is starting its tenth loan cycle. They know each other and are responsible. This is the temth loan that Mercy has with the group "Biakoye" ["Togetherness as one"]. Mercy has use her previous loans well as she improved the economy in her family. She has been selling clothing for 10 years now. She is 29 years, single and lives with her parents.

She requested the loan to buy clothing from the catalog to be able to increase her stock little by little and offer more variety to her clients. Mercy is the first person standing on the left side of the photo. She has a college called Roseline who also sell 'Kente' or African clothing fabric.

loans.use: to buy clothing from the catalog to be able to increase her stock little by little and offer more variety to her clients.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is 41 years old. She is a housewife who lives with her three children (two daughters and one son) and husband in Falakata, West Bengal. Her son is in grade 11, her elder daughter is studying for a B.A (bachelor in Arts) in her 1st year and her younger daughter is in grade 12.

Her husband Nabinchandra, 55 years old, is a cultivator by profession. He has a lot of experience in growing different types of grains and seasonal vegetables. In her free time, Anima assists her husband in different activities in the fields such as cleaning, collecting grains, fertilizing and more. They sell their harvest crops to dealers in nearby areas and grocery stores.

The income from this vegetable cultivation is insufficient to bear the expenses of such a large family. So they have decided to cultivate paddy. As it is the staple food of the local people, the crop has a very good demand.

She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase supplies, including paddy fertilizer, paddy seeds, and other items to start paddy cultivation and maintain her crops. Her future plans are to improve and expand her farm land to strengthen it so that she can grow more products. As a mother, she wants to offer a better quality of life and proper education to her children.

Anima conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rebati

texts.en:
52-year-old Rebati is an enterprising lady and mother of a daughter. Her daughter got married. Her husband is a fish vendor by occupation, he sells fish in the market. Rebati is illiterate but can sign her name. She lives with her husband in Kandi in West Bengal.

Rebati runs a puffed rice business. Locally puffed rice is called ‘muri’. Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very popular in rural areas.

Rebati makes puffed rice in her home and supplies it in her neighborhood. Gradually her customers are increasing. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income. But the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate. Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers' demand by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this financial help.

Rebati is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice and necessary materials for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Some years back she was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then through loans from Kashf Foundation she has initiated her business of hand embroidery.

Saiqa is a 30 years old, married woman, with 3 children. Saiqa is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Saiqa closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more embroidery supplies, such as beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a married woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She has one dependent aged 12.  Her husband is a farmer. Josefina engages in raising hogs and growing vegetables to help augment the income of their household. Josefina earns a living through her hog raising business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, supplements and fertilizer for her farm. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her business, which will allow her to augment her income. Her profit will be for healthy diet and school fees of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy piglets, supplements and fertilizer

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: For four years, Rufina works hard for her family. She sell home-cooked snacks like biko (rice cake), suman (glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed wrapped in palm or banana leaves) and deep fried banana with caramelized sugar.  She work hard so that she can provide for her two children ages ten and eight. Rufina is asking a loan to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, coconut and banana. Rufina is 30 years old from Duero, Bohol. In the future, she hopes to start a Sari-sari (general) store business.

loans.use: to buy  cooking oil, rice, sugar, coconut and banana

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro is a 47-year-old married man with five children. His youngest is nine years old and attending school.

Floro has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business in Trinidad, Bohol. He also farms rice for additional income. He has had this business for many years now. Floro earns about PHP 10,000 per month with the "habal-habal" business.

Floro is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor for hired farmers. He plans to expand his business for his child's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita, 45, hails from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She has four children. Her eldest is 22 while the youngest is 15 years old.

She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like noodles, fruit flavored juice, hard drinks, toiletries, sugar, biscuits and chips. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for 5 years now.

She would like to avail herself of the loan to buy variety of groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo and biscuits. These are vital in her day-to-day livelihood activity. These products could help Benita maintain the inventory of her store and means she will be able to settle her finances. Thus she could also provide her family with healthy diets.

Benita is hoping that in the long run, her livelihood will be successful and she is determined to continue and allow her children to finish their education for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy variety of groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo and biscuits.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, age 54, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been in this business for 15 years. In her store, she sells grocery items like canned goods, bread, eggs, noodles, snack foods, spices, and sugar. She also offers beverages like milk, soft drinks, and coffee. 
 
She and her husband have three children, and she works very hard to provide for them.
 
Norma requested a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store. 
 
Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a selling beauty products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from home products sales.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of beauty products to sell to customers.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Luzmaria

texts.en:
Luzmaria is 37 years old and single.

Luzmaria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products.

Luzmaria has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Luzmaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 37 years old and has two children. Divina is married and has two children who are presently in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Divina has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ruby is 41 years old and has eight children still in school.

Ruby has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ruby requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Ruby has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman, 62 years old and with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more charcoal and other materials for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling personal care products. Myrna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melek

texts.en:
Melek is married and a mother of four. She runs a millinery shop of her own. She started selling lingerie at home, then she worked in bazaars selling vegetables and fruits and then she opened her store. She has been a tradeswoman for years and is loved in her neighbourhood. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy products in bulk for her store. She wants to continue her work as long as her health permits.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Melek Hanım evli dört çocuk annesi. Kendine ait tuhafiye mağazası işletiyor. Evde çamaşır satışı ile başlıyor sonra uzun yıllar pazarcılık yapıyor ve daha sonra mahallesinde dükkan açıyor. Yıllardır esnaflık yapıyor ve çevresi tarafından seviliyor. Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına ürün alacak. Sağlığı el verdikçe işinin başından olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy things for her store.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia who is a 31 years old married woman, lives in Dusheti district with her husband, daughter and son, who are school-aged. The only employed person in the family is Maia's husband who gets 400 GEL per month. Maia wants to make her bit for the family's welfare, as the income is hardly enough for four-members family to satisfy increased needs.

According to above mentioned situation, Maia lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Maia to get a loan of 3700 GEL and start trading business. She will renovate the place, purchase all needed products and open a general store locally. Maia will start serving clients on her own and generate some income to increase the living condition of her family and give her children good education for progressing in life.
Maia and her family members will be very grateful for the financial support and kindness.

loans.use: to open a general store and thus make her own income.

loans.name: Sridebi

texts.en:
Sridebi lives in a small village of Kandi in West Bengal. She is a 24-year-old young married woman. She lives with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter). Her son is in grade 1 and her daughter is a toddler now. Sridebi studied till grade 7.

Sridebi is a housewife and her husband is a Toto rickshaw driver (a battery operated auto rickshaw) which has become a very popular vehicle in rural areas for carrying people over short distances. This Toto is the main source of income for the family. At present, the Toto rickshaw needs some repairing and also need a change of its controller so that it would be suitable for use on roads.

As he has no capital, Sridebi applied for a business loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to repair the Toto rickshaw and purchase a new controller for it. She hopes that their income will increase as well as strengthen the family economically. She wants to purchase another Toto-rickshaw with the profit generated from this business.

She expresses her gratitude towards her generous lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of repairing her husband's Toto rickshaw.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 35 years old, married woman. With her husband she is doing work in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Rehana has applied a loan of 40000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, with packs of insecticides and pesticides, for better crop production

loans.name: Phai Group

texts.en: Seesawan is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Seesawan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Seesawan and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Seesawan and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Seesawan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La prestamista es madre soltera de una niña de 10 años. En total, ha estado en tratamiento para una enfermedad compleja durante casi seis años. Actualmente ya terminó el tratamiento pero ha quedado con secuelas y le cuesta respirar. Estuvo trabajando como personal de limpieza en un mercado pero no pudo soportar el esfuerzo físico, terminaba agotada.  
Ella es el soporte económico de su hogar y debe sacar adelante a su hija. Hace un año quiso implementar un negocio de venta de golosinas pero su presupuesto era elevado, después pensó en la idea de una bodega pero también necesitaba un local y más presupuesto. Posteriormente, concluyó que podía alquilar cuartos ya que su padre le había entregado en herencia un espacio en su casa donde ella podía alquilar habitaciones. Ello no le generará mayor inversión porque solo necesita pintura, baños y puertas. Su padre la apoyará con la mano de obra por lo que no gastará en un maestro constructor.  

Necesita un préstamo para comprar cemento, arena gruesa, ladrillos, mayólicas. En un futuro desearía poder acondicionar más cuartos para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The borrower is a single mother with a ten year old daughter. She has been in treatment for a complex illness for a total of six years. She has now completed the treatment. However, she was left with after-effects, and it is difficult for her to breathe. She was working as a cleaner at a marker, but she could not handle the physical effort. She was exhausted when she finished.

She financially supports her household, and she needs to get her daughter ahead. A year ago she wanted to set up a business of selling sweets, but it was expensive to do so. Afterwards she had the idea of a grocery store, However, this also needed a location and more of a budget. After that, she came to the conclusion that she would be able to rent rooms because her father gave her an inheritance of space in his house where she would be able to rent rooms.

This would not generate greater investment because she only needs paint, bathrooms, and doors. Her father will help her with the labor so that she does not have to pay a builder. She needs a loan to buy cement, sand, coarse sand, bricks, and tiles.

In the future she wishes to be able to fix up more rooms in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to rent rooms in her house.

loans.name: Phonthan Group

texts.en: Seepaserd’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Seepaserd and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Seepaserd and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Seepaserd’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 54 years old. He is a hard-working and resourceful man. He is also creative. For two years now, he has baked bread and sold it in the community of Trinidad, Bohol. Fidel only uses what he can afford, an oven that is made of empty biscuit cans, a so called 'improvised oven'.

He is asking for a loan to buy flour and food for his family like canned goods and rice.

Fidel hope that in the future, he can improve and expand his business for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy flour and food for his family like canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a merchant from the town of Carmen, Bohol. She sells rtw (ready-to-wear) like pants, t-shirts, sandals, slippers and school bags.

She is 34 years old and is a married woman with a thirteen year old daughter. Almost 10 years now, Jocelyn has been in this kind of business for her livelihood. Her husband has an income from being a driver.

She could improve her source of income by having more supplies to cater for the needs of her respective customers. This could help maintain the flow of her merchandise and avoid shortages as well. Thus it would enable her to provide her child with basic needs including quality education.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to buy more supplies like bags and assorted footwear.

She is grateful for having the funds and she is doing her best to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like bags and assorted footwear.

loans.name: Maria Rosana

texts.en:
Maria Rosana has been engaged in farming for almost 20 years now. She grows and sells rice. She is a 50-year-old single woman residing in the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol.

She would like to avail herself of the funds to support her main source of living.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy farming supplies like fertilizers. These would improve her farm in terms of quality and volume as well. Thus, these will lead her to generate higher earnings and enable her to provide for her basic needs and pay her obligations. She could also start to expand and try new ways to improve her existing source of income.

She is hopeful that her livelihood will become productive and sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 53 years old and married with three children. Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Cristita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Cristita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and has eight children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, age 48, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been operating her business for 30 years. In her store, she sells grocery items like canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, bread, and snack foods. She also offers beverages like milk, soft drinks, and coffee. To earn an additional income, she buys and sells recycled materials. 

She and her husband have 10 children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

Marilyn has borrowed and successfully repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a loan in the amount of PhP 27,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store. 

Her goal is to save enough money to be able to afford to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a widowed woman, 63 years old and with two children.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Helen has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analyn is 37 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Analyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell on her food stall.

Analyn has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Doris

texts.fr: Doris  vous remercie beaucoup, tous les prêteurs qui lui ont aidé lors de son précédent crédit Kiva. Avec lequel, elle a pu renforcer et renouveler ses stocks de marchandise. Elle est très satisfaite de votre coup de pouce et très motivée à continuer à avancer et à développer son activité. Grâce à vous, son revenu s'améliore et elle peut continuer à effectuer le traitement de ses deux enfants malades. Cependant, la lutte n'est pas encore terminée, donc elle demande un autre crédit pour pouvoir encore aller de l'avant. Elle voudrait étendre de plus en plus son commerce et devenir grossiste plus tard.
texts.en:
Doris sincerely thanks all lenders who have made her previous Kiva loan possible. Thanks to this loan she has been able to restock and expand her merchandise selectio. She is very happy about getting this help and very motivated to keep going and developing her business further. Thanks to you, her revenues have improved, and she is able to continue paying medical expenses for her two children, who are ill. 

However, the battle is not yet won, and thus she is applying for another loan to be able to move forwards. She would like to continue growing her business and eventually become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, jugs of vegetable oil, bags of sugar, bags of dried vegetables and packs of soft drinks.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 53 years old, married and has six children.

Mildred is in the agriculture business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mildred has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel is 29 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agriculture business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Azel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Azel has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old and widowed with four children.

She is in the agriculture business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Margarita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Brigida is 34 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Brigida has a buy-and-sell Personal Collection business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Brigida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of Personal Collection items such as beauty soap, perfume, toothpaste, body lotion and other personal care products.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Personal Collection such as beauty soap, perfume, toothpaste, body lotion and other personal care products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a widowed woman of 69 years old with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell on her food stall.

Virginia has been in this business for 45 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia earns her living by operating a motorcycle transportation business. She earns an additional income through buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing items. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She and her husband have five children, and she works hard to support them.

Sonia requested a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy spare parts and gasoline as well as to perform maintenance on her motorcycle transportation vehicle.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline, as well as to perform maintenance on her motorcycle transportation vehicle

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit works hard to support her family. Lilit is single and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Lilit requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her weaving business.

Lilit has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lilit would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, age 63, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for three years. In her store, she offers grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, bread, snack foods, and spices. She also offers beverages like milk, soft drinks, and coffee.

She and her husband have five children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store.
