In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old and has three children. Jessica is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Jessica is in the agriculture business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jessica has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school tuition.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Claire is 45 years old and her child is still in school.

Claire has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, like meat, pork, fish, spices, and cooking oil, and other materials for her food production business.

Claire has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, pork, fish, spices, and cooking oil, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and one of her children is in school.

Estrella has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Estrella requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like underwear, pants, shorts, etc.

Estrella has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Estrella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like slippers, underwear, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 24 years old and married with one child. Ailyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ailyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 47 years old and has seven children. She is married and five of her children are presently in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetables seeds and other farm supplies. Analyn has been in this business for 14 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetables seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rea Mae

texts.en:
Rea Mae is 22 years old and single with two children.

She is in the agriculture business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rea Mae is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rea Mae has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hengie

texts.en:
Hengie, age 37, buys and sells seafood to earn her living. This hard-working entrepreneur has been engaged in this business for five years, buying seafood like crabs, shrimp, and oysters from fisherfolk and selling them to her customers.

Hengie and her husband have two children, one of whom still attends school, and she works very hard to support her family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 35,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy crabs, shrimp, oysters, and other kinds of seafood to offer for sale.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp, oysters, and other kinds of seafood to offer for sale

loans.name: Lilia Argentina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  el Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Lilia, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 22, 20 y 11 años de edad, la menor  estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos aun  viven con ellos. El marido es ebanista y comerciante.
Doña Lilia realiza el crédito para su esposo, el realizar lo necesario para darles lo mejor a su familia, él trabaja en un taller de ebanistería en el cual recibe un sueldo por su trabajo, pero también para ganar más dos a tres veces por semana  se desplaza hasta los campos a comprar chanchos los mismos que luego lleva a revender en los mercados de la ciudad a otros comerciantes, de esta forma el logra ganarse algo que junto con el sueldo del taller les ayuda a salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos para la venta de la semana.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the El Floron area of the Portoviejo city, capital of Manabi and known for years as the city of the real tamarinds, every fifteen days, the credit group El Renacer (The Rebirth) holds their meetings.

This is also where Mrs. Lilia lives, she is 38 years old and in a common-law marriage with three children ages 22, 20 and 11. The youngest, a girl, studies at school. Two of their children still live at home with the couple. The husband is a cabinet maker and merchant.

Mrs. Lilia is requesting the loan on behalf of her husband, who does whatever is necessary to provide the best for his family. He works in a woodworking shop and receives a salary for his work, but sometimes to earn more, two or three times a week he goes out to the country and buys pigs which he eventually sells in the city markets and to other merchants. This way he is able to earn something which, coupled with his salary from the workshop, helps them get ahead.

This loan will be used to purchase pigs to sell during the week. She has been with the credit group since the beginning and likes the help that the institution provides. Her dreams are to provide the very best for her children.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Nikolin

texts.en:
In the photo is Nikolin and his wife, Flora. This loan will be used to build a new stable as the existing one that he repaired with his previous loan is almost ready to collapse.The region where they live has the coldest climate in the country, snowing for about six months in a row. Also, homes and other primitive buildings get damaged very easily.
Nikolin now has a fourth child and as far as livestock, he's got one dairy cow, one sheep and two sows.

loans.use: to build a new stable for the animals before the snow starts.

loans.name: You Get What You Give - N07Tsơn1Psơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is 42 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling vegetables for more than 10 years. Hoa lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh vegetables to resell. In 2012, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income has increased significantly. She is the group leader of "You get what you give - N07TSơn1PSơn", which consists of 5 members. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia vive en la ciudad de Ita es madre soltera, trabaja en una estación de servicios, y a la vez estudia la carrera de enfermería.
Desea terminar sus estudios y ser una profesional, busca tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hijo  quien es su inspiración para seguir estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar la cuota de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo, y luchando por su futuro y el de su hijo.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in the city of Ita. She is a single mother. She works at a service station and is studying for a nursing career at the same time. She wishes to complete her education and be a professional. She seeks a better quality of life for herself and her son, who is her inspiration to continue studying. 

She requests this loan in order to pay her university tuition costs. In this way she can continue studying, like she has been doing, and fighting for her future and that of her son.

loans.use: to pay university tuition costs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
For the last 15 years , Angelita has been selling salted fish. She sells fish from a location situated inside the market place where she lives.

She is 46 years of age and married with three children. Her oldest child is 25 and the youngest is 14. She lives in the town of Carmen, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy additional salted fish and to pay for transportation fees.

Angelita wants to continue her day-to-day business and support her family as well. She could gradually set aside some savings and be able to pay her obligation.
Thus, Angelita could improve her livelihood and continue to expand her business to become successful and continue support the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy additional salted fish and to pay transportation fees.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 44 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Synik region. Artak lives alone and he is not married. Last year his mother died. Artak used to work in different places and did various jobs but now is on his own, so he gives taxi services around his region.

This is the only source of income for him to cover his needs. The Kiva loan is very important for Artak since now his car is out of order and he cannot drive it. With this loan of 400.000 Armenian drams, Artak will repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car, which he uses as a taxi to support himself.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a father of five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and earns a salary as a head teacher. He gets additional income from cocoa farming which he has done for years. He works hard and has plans of educating his children, buying land and expanding his cocoa growing. His main challenges are price changes and expensive labor to expand the cocoa business. Besides that he also doesn't have money to pay school fees for his children this promotion term, hence he is seeking a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of three. She has been sewing since she was young. During the early years of her marriage, she sewed at home to make a contribution to the family budget. Later on she opened a tailor's shop of her own and she has been sewing since then. She also sells Amway products.

This year she will be teaching sewing in the Public Educational courses. She wants to help young girls to have a profession. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy fabric in bulk and materials for her shop.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fatma hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Gençliğinden beri dikiş dikiyor. Evliliğinin ilk yıllarında eşine destek olmak için dikiş dikmeye başlıyor. Daha sonraları mahallesin de kendine terzi dükkanı açıyor ve senelerdir burada müşterilerine hizmet veriyor. Aynı zamanda Amwey ürün satışı da yapıyor. Bu sene Halk eğitimin açtığı kurslarda dikiş öğretmenliği görevi de alacak. Mesleğini devam ettirmek genç kızlara yardımcı olarak meslek edinmelerine yardımcı olmak istiyor. Aldığı kredi ile dükkana kumaş vs. ürünler alacak.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials

loans.name: Zuleekha

texts.en:
Zuleekha is 52 years old lady, mother of five daughters and one son and residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. Her husband has been doing a business of selling milk for the past 6 years.

Zuleekha's husband wants to purchase a dairy cow for his milk business purposes, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase this animal
Therefore Zuleekha has requested for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy a cow for her milk, to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.
On this financial assistance Zuleekha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's milk business, so as to have a better income

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta estudiando la carrera de psicología, con el propósito de poder ayudar a las demás personas con su profesión.
Tiene como meta cuando termine su carrera, el seguir estudiando y poder ejercer ampliamente la profesión que eligió.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is studying psychology in order to help people through her profession.

Her goal upon completing her career is to continue studying and be able to exercise extensively the profession which she has chosen.

She is requesting this loan to be able to make the payments for her career and in this manner be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: make her University payments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables such as: water spinach, cabbage, carrots, tomato, spinach, etc

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en:
Watfa is a 26 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Her husband represents the main income earner in the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas S.A.L to pay the first installment of their study fees and to buy their books. She will be more than happy to see them graduate and achieve their master’s degrees. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children's study fees and to buy their books

loans.name: Daxi Mirella

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Daxi, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, ambos estudian en universidad y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo traba en una ferretería.
Doña Daxi es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y cosméticos, Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus momentos libres y también vende en su casa a sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva 17  años dedicada a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y  cosméticos. Lleva 17 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the El Floron area of the Portoviejo city, capital of Manabi and known for years as the city of the real tamarinds, every fifteen days, the credit group El Renacer (The Rebirth) holds their meetings.

This is also where Mrs. Daxi lives, she is 50 years old, married and has two children that are of age. They are both enrolled in university and still live with her at home. Her husband works at a hardware store.

Mrs. Daxi is a woman who loves to work to help her husband with the home's expenses. She works in commerce, selling clothes and cosmetics. She sells door-to-door, going out in her free time and also selling from her home to her most well-known customers. She sells on credit and collects payments weekly or biweekly. She has been doing this for 17 years which she started with the first credit she received from the group.

This loan will be used to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and cosmetics. She has been with the credit group for 17 years and she likes it because of the credits which helped her start her business. Her dream is for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: purchase pants, shirts, blouses and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad, ella con la ayuda de sus padres ha podido salir adelante y superar los obstáculos.
Comenta que su meta es poder recibirse y ejercer su profesión, hacerse conocida y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Jose pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios, esforzándose por ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Jose is studying Accounting. He with the help of his parents, has been able to get ahead and overcome all obstacles.

He comments that his goal is to graduate and work in his profession, make himself known and be able to help other people.

Jose is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees and in this way be able to continue his studies and become somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Journalism is a field that Malika wants to connect her future with. She has finished choreographic college, and has a ballet diploma.  All her life is connected with art, and she wants to continue in this way. She considers journalism close to art, and hopes to develop her creative abilities and skills in the future. She wants to become one of the best journalists in Kyrgyzstan so as to provide people with reality and truth.Another reason for her choosing this department is that she is sociable and communicative. She loves writing stories and publishing them in internet resources.  In this way, she can show people the variety of cultures and ways of life of many nationalities that she has been raised among. Writing and sharing with others gives her an opportunity to be heard and to learn others' opinions. Her family has only one breadwinner. She has two younger siblings, nine and two years old, and her mother takes care of the last one at home. She is proud of her nine-year-old brother, as he is a swimmer and has won many prizes in different competitions. As they both are talented, they used to have discounts at school, and so they paid reduced amounts for everything. Now, her parents are facing difficulty in paying her tuition at the university. She is confident that she is in the right place, and that studying at AUCA she will bring fresh ideas to this place, benefiting all of them. She kindly asks Kiva lenders to help her to improve herself and to make Kyrgyzstan youth well educated in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education costs at AUCA

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot is 44 and a married father of four. The oldest child, who goes to university, is 20 and the youngest is 14.

His family owns two dynym (an area of land 1/10th of a hectare) of agricultural land where they plant seasonal veggies for the family consumption and have some orchards such as figs, pomegranates, plums, persimmons and grapevines. In addition to that, Kastriot uses his crafty talents to make some extra cash on the side. As seen in the picture, he makes and sells cradles. Note that in the northern part of the country where he lives, children until the age of nine months old are put in cradles even nowadays. This was a rural custom before, followed to the letter by every family and it still goes on for the poor in the rural area. Hence, cradles are in demand and Kastriot has been making them since he started about seven years ago. He gets roughly $400/month selling them at the farmer's market, every Sunday. His wife works in shoe manufacturing located in the nearest town.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university fees and student dormitory payment

loans.name: Los Kantus De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco “LOS KANTUS DE SAN JERONIMO” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  
La socia Primitiva 55 años de edad  tiene 04 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia está solicitando el préstamo para comprar azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen a los inversionistas de  KIVA por permitirles continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Kantus De San Jeronimo communal bank in the city of Cusco in Peru. Primitiva, age 55, is the member. She has four children, and she is a widow. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, and milk, among others. She has been in the business for a good amount of time. It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.

She wishes to be able to continue working in this way in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy sugar and milk, among other products.

The members of the bank are grateful to the Kiva lenders for allowing them to continue with their business activities. These businesses represent the main financial income and support of their families.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk, among other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from a town in Carles, Iloilo, Philippines. She is a widow woman and has three adult children.

Since her children are already grown up, 60-year-old Elizabeth works hard for the future. She has been running a hog raising business for almost three years.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed, since the hog raising business takes a few months before she could get back her earnings.

In the future, Elizabeth wants to improve her business. Perhaps she will save the money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Cecilia Matilde

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  el Grupo de Crédito Renacer.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y la menor  que estudia en universidad, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es chofer. Ella hace muchos años aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Cecilia es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y que mejor con una labor que le encanta como es la del arreglo personal, ella tiene un salón de belleza en su casa, allí  realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas, entre otros trabajos, ella también realiza trabajos a domicilio cuando sus clientes lo requieren así. Además también en su local vende productos de belleza. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le encanta.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, tratamientos para el cabello, esmaltes, cremas, entre otras cosas. Es fundadora del Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí and long known as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Renacer credit group meet every 15 days.

This is where Cecilia lives. She is 44 years old and is in a civil union relationship from which she has three children. All the children are grown although they still live with her. The youngest attends university. The husband is a driver.

Many years ago Cecilia learned beauty and personal care at a local academy. She is a woman who likes to earn her own way, especially if she can do something she loves such as personal care. She runs a beauty salon out of her house where she cuts and dyes hair, polishes nails, etc. She also goes to her customers' houses when required. She also sells beauty products from her shop. She has been doing this for more than ten years, and she loves it.

She will use this loan to buy dyes, hair treatments, polishes, creams, etc. She is a founder of the Credit Group and she likes it because of all the assistance she receives from the group. Her dream is to continue to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments, dyes, nail polish, creams, etc.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is a single woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Rose is 24 years old and has one child still in school.

Mary Rose has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Mary Rose requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman, 42 years old. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Margie has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 37 years old and has three children. She is single and has two children who are currently in school.

Glory is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Glory has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is married and a mother of three. She sells Tupperware products. They were having financial problems so she started this business and has been selling Tupperware for nine years. She says that she earns good money and helps with the needs of her husband and her children's school needs easily. With the help of the third loan she is planning to buy Tupperware products in bulk. She bought herself a car, now she is wants to buy a house.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hicran Hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi. Tupperwere ürün satışı yapıyor. Bu işe maddi sıkıntılardan dolayı başlamış. Ne iş yapabilirim diye düşünürken çevresinden görerek Tupperware işine başlıyor. Dokuz buçuk senedir Tupperwere satışı yapıyor. Çok iyi kazandığını bu işle eşine ve evine katkı sağladığını çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını rahatlıkla karşıladığını söylüyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile Tupperwere ürünü alacak. Arabasını aldı şimdi de bir ev almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products.

loans.name: Tereze

texts.en: Tereze wants to buy a cash register for her little eatery and also some inventory. Up until now small stores and other businesses never used cash registers. Corruption stands very high in Albania. At the same time, small store owners make gross earnings of only (USD) $100 to $200/month while the minimum monthly pay is supposed to be (USD) $400 per month. However, with the new regulations that every business now has to be registered and use a cash register, the poverty, unfortunately, is rapidly increasing, causing early death to elders.

loans.use: to buy a cash register and to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Luque, son 15 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, están esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo unido de todas.
Una de las personas que se destaca es la Sra. Nancy, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos de prendas y por medio de sus ventas quiere poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que lucha por sus ideales para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the city of Luque and is made up of 15 women, all friends and neighbours in the city. They are striving to improve their living conditions through working together.

One person that stands out is Nancy, who earns a living selling a variety of clothes. She has a good clientele who are always placing orders for clothing and through these sales she wants to be able to help her family and other loved ones.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and other things. This way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

She see herself as a person who fights for her ideals in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell such as: t-shirts, shirts, pants and other things.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a married woman. She is from Duero, Bohol. She is engaged in a buy and sell business of pigs and rice. She also raise hogs for an income. She relies on this business to provide for her family. She is asking a loan to buy piglets, feed and rice. Sharon dreamed of being a successful so she can save for old age, eat healthy diet and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and rice

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ya es una profesional Abogada, esta continuando con sus estudios, y la carrera que ahora está siguiendo es la de didáctica universitaria para poder ser una docente universitaria.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios para poder mejorar en su profesión. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Laura is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is already a lawyer but is continuing with her studies so she can be a university professor.

She is asking for this loan so she can pay her tuition and be able to continue with her studies to advance in her profession. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving which is allowing her to make something out of her life.

loans.use: to pay tuition for school.

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
Merian is 29 years old and married with three children, three children are presently in school, Merian works very hard to provide for them.

Merian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Merian has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Rosselin

texts.en:
Rosselin is 32 years old and married with five children, three of whom are presently in school. She is in the agricultural business, growing bananas in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosselin has been in this business for seven years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
This young man is 29 years old and his name is Karen. He lives with his mother in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. His father works abroad.

In his native village with his beloved mother, Karen is engaged in farming and agriculture. On his farm he has cows, calves, lambs and sheep. He sells a rather large amount of meat to city butchers and mainly from the meat sale he earns a good profit for his family. Karen’s mother also sells milk and macun (national dairy-product) to their neighbors.

This young man is also skilled in land cultivation and he manages to have a good harvest of potatoes and tomatos, which he sells mainly to re-sellers. Now with the help of Kiva lenders Karen wants to provide his farm cattle with a lot of fodder, so all the loan amount he plans to use for fodder purchase for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to use for fodder purchase for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 47 years old and she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. She is a widow and she lives with her two sons. Anahait has higher pedagogical education and she is a specialist of Russian Language and Literature.

Now Anahit already has 20 years of pedagogical experience and she also gives private courses of her subject preparing them for the entrance exams. Anahit also is engaged in agricultural works and she has a nice fruit and vegetable garden.

Anahit asks her Kiva loan as she wants to buy a gas heater in order to heat the room where she is giving her private courses and with the remainder of the loan she will buy a computer and also professional literature for her courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for her courses

loans.name: Gülsüm

texts.en:
Gülsüm is retired and living with her mother. She is selling Tupperware and Herbalife products. After retirement, with and advice from a friend, she started this business to pass her time and to make money. She says that with the help of this business she has a different neighbourhood and she is very pleased with it. With the help of the second loan she is planning to buy Tupperware and Herbalife products in bulk. Her aim is to live a healthy life.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülsüm hanım emekli, annesi ile birlikte yaşıyor. Tupperware ve Herbalife ürün satışı yapıyor. Emekli olduktan sonra bir arkadaşının önerisi ile hem boş vakitlerini geçirmek hem de maddi kazanç sağlamak amacı ile başlıyor. Bu işle değişik bir çevreye sahip olduğunu bundan da memnun olduğunu söyledi. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile Tupperware ve Herbalife ürünleri alacak. Hayali sağlıklı bir y aşam.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware and Herbalife products for re-sale.

loans.name: Phonthong Group

texts.en:
Kham’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Kham and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Kham and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Kham’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 29-years old woman, living with her eight children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Naseem’s husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time, so he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has to feed his children and now his children are growing older and their needs increase as well.

Shehas been making savings for many days to buy a new moto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing some money has become short. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new moto rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Naseem hopes that now her husband would be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy moto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Fatush

texts.en:
This is Fatush and her husband, Zadrim. They are parents of two married children and are villagers in their early 60's from a village located in the central part of Albania that once was considered a picturesque place to visit. After the collapse of the regime, it was ruined but has slowly started to rebuild.

Fatush wants to buy fertilizer for her plantation. She has planted 250 peach trees on 5 dynyms of agricultural land her family owns. She did not plant all the trees at once so production is increasing as the orchard expands. She hopes that the production quantity doubles next year.

Fatush sells her fruit to wholesale buyers so villagers do not have to find clientele and/or pay for transportation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plantation.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en:
Ndue is 52 and married and is the father of eight children; the oldest is 28 and the youngest is 8. They live in northern Albania. His family doesn't own much agricultural land except the little front and back yards where they mainly plant for the family's consumption. However, he does own livestock and so far has 13 goats and 13 baby goats. He wants to expand on this activity, because he not only sees it as profitable, but he is also an animal lover with a special interest in goats. "I find them clean and easy to manage. At times i take them grazing up in the mountains. And their cheese is good," said Ndue smiling while being interviewed by the loan officer.

The family's income is as follows: disability of one child in an amount of $99/month and an equal amount for Ndue's wife, who is the caretaker of the disabled child. A son of his makes a monthly pay of $300/month and about $900/year comes from the sale of baby goats.

The loan that he is requesting from you will be used to pay for a little get together type of thing because his daughter is getting married and she is the oldest child in the family.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's little marriage event that is a rural custom, making parents pay for it followed even today.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 39 years old, married woman and works in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to make an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for her hand embroidery business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 43 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business and is fattening a pig in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Allen has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам  веселый, энергичный  мужчина в возрасте 36 лет. Он женат, имеет двое детей. Он работает строителем в селе а еще после работы занимается дехканством. Рустам и его жена уже в протяжении многих лет живут очень счастливо, они поддерживают друг друга всегда и во  всех ситуациях.  Они  делают все для того чтобы их дети выросли порядочными ,честными людьми, поэтому  он  делает все необходимое для их полноценного развития. Он хочет обеспечить их во всем. В первую очередь он хочет чтобы они жили в теплом уютном доме, именно поэтому Рустам хочет  ремонтировать свой дом чтобы ,подготовится к зиме и сделать своим детям удобство. Рустам хорошо зарабатывает, но в данное время у него нет такое большое количество денег. Поэтому  он  обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарен Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Rustam is a cheerful, energetic 36-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He works as a builder in the village and he also farms after work. Rustam and his wife have been living very happily for many years. They support each other at all times and in all situations. They do everything for their children to grow up decent, honest people. For this reason he does everything necessary for their full development. He wants to provide them with everything. First of all he wants them to live in a warm, comfortable house, and so Rustam wants to renovate his house to ready it for the winter and make it convenient for his children. Rustam earns well, but at the present time he does not have such a large sum of money, so he has applied to Arvand for a loan. He is grateful in advance to Arvand for its support!

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Bukurie

texts.en:
Bukurie's three children, ranging in age from 8 to 15, have been living in a house without proper doors and windows. Instead, they had placed some linens and other old clothes to cover the cold. Soon the snow will start in their region, and for the children to sleep and stay in a house where the bitter cold, snow and rain comes in easily, it presents a risk to their health. "Last year, my kids were sick the entire year, with two of them getting severely sick and we spent so much money on antibiotics and their immune system became so weak afterwards. I don't want my kids to go through the same thing this year," said Bukurie to the branch assistant who interviewed her in our branch office.

For the past ten years, she's been having mostly dairy cows, one at a time, using the milk for the family and selling a baby calf a year to make about $500/year. In the little land they own, they just plant for the family. Bukurie's husband receives a disability income of about $150/month and another disability in an amount of $130/month for her born blind mother-in-law who lives with them. They are literally struggling to make ends meet.

loans.use: to install doors and windows in the house where three young children and two disabled persons live.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 49-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 7 years old.

Her husband is a fisherman and Alicia helps her husband in doing this business to earn a living. She has been helping her husband for a year. They work together, perhaps to give their daughters a good education.

They are requesting a loan for boat repair, so they can buy plywood, nails and paint.

Alicia wants to upturn their livelihood to have a living. She dreams to be rich in the future.

loans.use: to make boat repairs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman, 57 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Imelda has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 49 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Maria Theresa has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and has a live-in partner with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maria has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 72 years old and married with three children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 21 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Consolacion aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Indra

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Indra, one of Ruma's agents. Indra and his wife live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. They have been blessed with one daughter. Indra sells mobile phone airtime for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. He is also wants to learn about how to improve his business more.

As the business runs, Indra is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. Indra is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, who needs access to such services.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es de la ciudad de Concepción, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere ser útil a sus padres y también para sus hermanos.
Ella pone su mejor esfuerzo ya que quiere poder ayudar a sus seres.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Griselda is from the city of Concepción. She is studying nursing, and she comments that through her studies, she wants to be useful to her parents and also her siblings.

She gives her best effort since she wants to be able to help her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the payment of tuition costs for her degree, and in this way, she can continue with her studies as she is currently doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition costs.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.pt:
A senhora Fátima de 32 anos de idade é professora, casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 1 ainda menor, 1 a estudar no ensino primário e outro no secundário,  vive na  casa do serviço.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  chapas de zinco, barrotes, pregos, varões, cimento para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu sonho é melhor as condicoes sócio- económico da sua familia
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiros e conta com ajuda de seu esposo que é militar para supera-los e que com os empréstimos anteriores iniciou a sua obra.
texts.en:
Fátima, 32, is a teacher. She is married, and the mother of three children; one of them is still very young, one goes to primary school, and the other one to secondary school. She lives in a house provided by her employer. 

She says that with the requested amount she will buy zinc sheets, bars, nails, beams, and cement to continue with the construction works.

Her dream is to improve the socio-economic conditions of her family. She says that her biggest challenge is of a financial nature. Her husband, who works for the military, helps her to overcome it. With the previous loans, she started the construction works.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, bars, nails, beams, and cement.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 28 years old and she is married. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for eight years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

One of the most difficult problems in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, age 58, raises pigs to earn her living. Susana has been in this business for six years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She and her husband have six children, and she works hard to provide for them.

Susana requested a loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 34 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joan has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and groceries.

In the future Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 50 years old, is married and has five children, one still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past ten years, Gemma has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 30 years old and married with one kid.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Supriyatna

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Supriyatna, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in Depok, a suburban area located about a one-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. He owns and manages a small stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity.

As the business grows, Supriyatna needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Supriyatna's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to open an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Supriyatna is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, who needs access to such services.

loans.name: Berta

texts.pt:
A senhora Berta de 44 anos de idade  é auxilia de limpeza e comerciante, casada e mãe de 8 filhos dos quais 4 a estudarem, 4 já maiores de idade e nas suas casas, sustenta 4 netos dos quais 2 enviando-lhe dinheiro e os outros 2 que vivem com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  açúcar, feijão, óleo, arroz, amendoim, omo peixe, frangos para revender no seu estabelecimento.
O seu sonho é desenvolver seu negócio, adquirir uma viatura para ajudar lhe no transporte de mercadorias para o seu negócio.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é o financeiro e conta com ajuda de seu esposo para supera-los. Com os empréstimos anteriores fez a atual barraca pois antes vendia ao relento e adquiriu um congelador que usa no seu negócio .
texts.en:
Berta, 44, works as a housekeeper and businesswoman. She is married and the mother of eight children; four of them go to school, four are now adults and live in their own houses. She sustains four grandchildren. She sends money to two of them, and the remaining two live with her in a house she owns.

She says that she will use the loan to buy sugar, beans, vegetable oil, rice, peanuts, OMO washing powder, fish, and chickens to resell in her store.

Her dreams are to develop her business, and purchase a vehicle to transport the products she sells in her store.

She says that her biggest challenge is financial in nature, and that her husband helps her to overcome it. With the previous loans, she built the store where she works now (before, she sold her products outdoors), and bought a freezer that she uses now in her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, vegetable oil, rice, peanuts, OMO washing powder, fish, and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari continua esforzándose en sus estudios de enfermería, es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza por ser una profesional, es por ello que pone todo de si para poder lograrlo. comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda y por lo que está muy agradecida.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta sus cuotas y seguir así con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mari continues to work hard in her nursing studies and she is a strong willed person who strives to be professional, which is why putting everything in to achieving this.

She says her previous loan was used to pay her university fees, which was very helpful and for which she is very grateful.

Today she is applying for a new loan to pay back her fees in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La Señorita Lucila es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella estudia la carrera de enfermería, y a la vez trabaja en una Farmacia.
Es una persona que se esfuerza por sus metas para poder ser una profesional y así poder ayudar a su familia y también a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su tesis, y de esa forma poder terminar bien sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucila is from the city of Curuguaty. She is studying to become a nurse, and works in a pharmacy. She is a person who fights to reach her goals and become a professional, in order to help her family and society in general.

She is requesting a loan to cover her graduation costs in order to finish her studies according to plan.

loans.use: to cover her graduation costs.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane, 44 years old, is married and has four children, three of them still in school. Jeane works very hard to provide for them.

For the past two years, Jeane has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods and personal care products, to sell. Jeane would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods and personal care products, to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, 45 years old, is married and has one child. She has an agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Corazon has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Corazon has been in this business for eighteen years and has previously borrowed five loans from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a 55-year-old widowed woman and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has four children, one of whom is still in school.

Haide has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her tricycle.

Haide has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintainance for her tricycle

loans.name: Mirlina

texts.en:
Mirlina is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. She is asking for a PHP 14,000 loan amount to buy more dried fish to sell.

Mirlina has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies. Ernalyn has been in this business for sixteen years and has taken out and repaid thirteen prior loans from NWTF. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Simprosa

texts.en:
Simprosa is 50 years old and married, and she has eight children, four of whom are presently in school.

Simprosa is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines.

Simprosa requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Simprosa has been in this business for 20 years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a 50-year old widowed man with eight children. Four of his children are still attending school, and they are 10-17 years old respectively.

Vicente earns his livelihood by engaging in habal-habal (motorcycle with extended seat) transportation services. He has been transporting passengers from one place to remote areas for 20 years now.

Aside from that, he also engages in farming. He grows and sells rice, as supplemental income.

He is asking for a loan to pay for motor maintenance and farm supplies like fertilizers. With these, he can continue to operate his transportation services and also improve the yield of his farm.

Thus, he can settle his obligations and start to expand both of his sources of income.

He dreams that he will be able to support the education of his children by handling his livelihood well.

loans.use: to pay for motor maintenance and farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama “Nueva Vida”, lleva este nombre ya que las integrantes buscan una nueva vida para sus familias, por medio de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Gladys quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes y lociones, es muy buena vendedora es por eso que le va muy bien y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Es muy luchadora y comenta que a través de sus ventas ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes variados, colonias y lociones, y así poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
This group is called “Nueva Vida” [New Life]. The members chose this name because they want a new life for their families, with the help of Fundación Paraguaya, and through the Poverty Elimination Program.

One of the members is Gladys, who sells perfumes and lotions. She is a good saleswoman, which is why she is doing so well and has so many customers. She is a fighter, and says that she helps her family by selling her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy assorted perfumes, colognes, and lotions. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales, as she has been doing so far. She is thankful for the opportunity of continuing with her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy assorted perfumes, colognes, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 49 years old, married and, has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirly has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Shirly requested her second loan from NWTF for 28,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, Shirly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman, 47 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ready-to-wear clothing like pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Glenda has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing like pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She earns additional income from direct sales of personal collection products. Josefina has been in this business for 26 years.

Josefina successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Virgilio es vendedor ambulante en su ciudad de Santaní, comenta que por medio de sus ventas mantiene y da a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones, el es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza cada día para que a su familia no le falte nada. 
Hoy pide este préstamo para la compra de productos para la venta, como ropas, calzados y otros, de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Virgilio is a street vendor from the city of Santaní. He says that he sustains his family thanks to his sales and that he gives them a dignified life and makes sure they do not lack anything. He is a hardworking person that fights everyday so that his family has everything they need.

He is requesting a loan today to buy products to sell, such as clothes and footwear. In this way, he will be able to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло  житель района Шахритуз.  Ему  45 лет.  У Асатулло образование высшее. Три года как занимается  животноводством. В его деятельности помогает ему его семья. Его бизнес приносить ему не малый доход.  В данный момент ему надо закупить  несколько рогатого скота для продажи мясо.  Кроме этого он хочет сам выращивать мелкий рогатый скот.  По этой причине он обратился за кредитом.  Ему нужна Ваша помощь,  и он очень надеется на Вашу поддержку. Асатулло очень позитивный и трудолюбивый человек.
texts.en: Asatullo is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 45 years old. Asatullo has a higher education. He has been rearing animals for three years. His family helps him with his business. His business brings him a good income. At the present time he needs to buy a few livestock to sell their meat. Apart from this he wants to rear some sheep and goats. For this reason he has applied for a loan. He needs your help, and very much hopes for your support. Asatullo is a very positive and hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy a few heads of livestock to sell for meat.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 29 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Jane has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 39 years old, is married and has two children. For the past five years, she has operated an agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Margie earns additional income from poultry.

Margie successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Margie works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 52 years old, is married and has four children, one in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past five years, Teresita has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Erene

texts.en:
Erene is a 36-year-old married woman with four children.

Erene works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 3 years. She requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, snacks foods, and personal care products.

Erene has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF. She earns additional income selling vegetables.

Erene aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, snacks foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family by operating a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 15 years and is a married woman.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 45 years old and with her husband, two daughters and son she lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Susanna works in a private workshop as a tailor and having good skills in this sphere she also takes orders at her house and she sews nice clothes both for women and men. She mentions that she has a lot of regular customers who thanks to her good work and her unique models, already gave her different orders of clothes sewing for many years.

Now she decided to refresh both the assortment of her models and the fabrics. So she hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with the loan amount and she wants to buy a computer and through it find new model for clothes sewing and she will also buy new assortments of fashionable fabrics for her work.

loans.use: to buy a computer and through it find new models for clothes sewing and she will also buy a new assortment of fashionable fabrics for her work.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato, 31 years old young woman, is from capital of Georgia, Tbilisi. She lives with her sister, who is a nanny and gets 500 GEL per month. Nato has just opened a kindergarten and day care center, fit it out with all the needed equipment, beds, tables, chairs and toys for children, with the saved money and now requested financial support to cover the lease cost of the place.

She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows poor and inexperienced people like Nato to get a chance for starting or re-starting business.

Nato and her sister will take care with the children and get a stable source of income especially from local people, who live nearby the kindergarten.
After the business is started, the family will have a regular income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. With support of the Start Up program Nato will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle with the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to cover the lease costs of her newly-opened kindergarten and day care center.

loans.name: Naphotai Group

texts.en: Songleulor is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Songleulor and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Songleulor and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Songleulor and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Songleulor and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Manija

texts.ru:
Манижа молодая 21 летняя жена и мать одного 3 летного ребенка. Она живет вместе братом, снохой, мужем и ребенком. За ребенком ухаживает сноха, потому что ее сноха домохозяйка а Манижа занимается шитьем женской одежды в ателье,  чтобы зарабатывать и помочь мужу обеспечить семью. У нее дружная и прекрасная семья. Манижа научилась шить три года назад и уже имеет хороший опыт. Ей нравится ежедневный доход, и она просто обожает шить.
В настоящий момент Манижа планирует купить стройматериалы для ремонта дома и оплатит за услуги мастера. Манижа с мужем накопили определенную сумму денег для ремонта дома, но им еще не хватает немного средств. Чтобы достичь своих целей Манижа обратилась за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать сейчас эту молодую девушку, и она будут благодарны вам за поддержку!
texts.en:
Manija is a young 21-year-old wife and mother of a three-year-old child. She lives with her brother, sister-in-law, husband and child. Her sister-in-law looks after her child because her sister-in-law is a homemaker and Manija sews women's clothes in a workshop in order to earn money and help her husband to provide for the family. She has a tight-knit and wonderful family. Manija learned to sew three years ago and already has good experience. She likes the daily income, and she simply loves sewing.

At the present time Manija plans to buy construction materials to renovate her house and pay for a builder's services. Manija and her husband have saved up a certain sum of money for the house renovation, but they still lack a bit of money. In order to achieve their goals, Manija has applied for a loan. Now you can support this young woman, and she will be grateful to you for the support!

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for a builder's services.

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie and her husband have a fishing business and they live in the town of Carles, in Iloilo. They raised their five children, their 18 year old still needs their support.

Ammie is asking a loan to buy a new fishing net to improve their catch. She wants to continue their business have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a 57-year-old married woman with six children.

Lanie works hard to provide for her family and has runa a general store for 35 years.

She requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, snacks foods, and personal care products.

Lanie has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF. She earns additional income from weaving.

Lanie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, snacks foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 53-year-old married with five children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lea has had a food vending business for 5 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from fruit vending.

Edna is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients and materials like tempura, cooking oil, hotdog, bamboo stick, etc. for her business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and materials like tempura, cooking oil, hotdog, bamboo stick, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ferawati

texts.en:
Ferawati and her husband live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. They own and manages a small stall that sells mobile airtime credits and phone accessories to their community. They also realize that in order to support their children's education in the future, they have to save more money. Ferawati and her husband are very determined people; they work hard and are persistent in what they do.

Ferawati needs a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile airtime credits, especially on the weekends.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community who need access to such services.

loans.name: Villeta Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Villeta Poty está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, está trabajando de manera unida para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virgilia quien tiene una despensa con la cual ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, ella comenta que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio y con ello ayuda a su familia, para poder darles una vida digna.
Virgilia pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, carne, panificados, frutas y otros productos, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
