The Villeta Poty group is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to move forward. The group is working together to be able to improve their quality of life and that of their loved ones.

One of the members is Senora Virgilia who has a food store with which she helps her family and her loved ones. She says that little by little she has been improving her business and with it she helps her family, in order to be able to give them a decent life.

Virgilia is requesting this loan to be able to stock her business with vegetables, meat, breads, fruits, and other products, and in that way be able to continue giving her clients everything they need.

The women are grateful for the opportunity they receive to be able to improve their life conditions and that of their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bread, fruit, and other products.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine is a 39-year-old woman from the town of Carles, in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has two children ages five and three years old. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him with this business. They have been doing this for one year. They work hard to provide for the needs of their children through this livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy a boat engines and materials such as plywood, paint and glue. In the future, she wishes to improve their livelihood for a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine and materials such as plywood, paint and glue.

loans.name: Amy Leah

texts.en:
Amy Leah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Amy Leah successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Amy Leah's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Wennah Jean

texts.en:
Wennah Jean is 34 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in enrolled in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Wennah Jean has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marakhy

texts.en:
Marakhy is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marakhy has had a retail apparel business for 4 years. She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy blouses, shorts, and pants.

Marakhy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  blouses, shorts, and pants.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 60-year-old married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Adelaida has had a peanut butter business for 20 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sugar and oil.

Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and oil.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 49 years old, with two children. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Dolores has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edna is 48 years old now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her business. She is asking for a PHP 14,000 loan amount to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Edna has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 21-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband. She is a mother of one child. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family. As for her, she works in a local restaurant near to her place.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to pay her child's educational fees and to buy his books. She is very eager to make use of the loan as her only purpose is to ensure him an education to be competitive with others to reach higher positions in his professional career.

This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and is eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees and to buy his books.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama El Paraiso está en su Segundo  ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas trabajan y están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una persona digna de destacarse es la Sra. Hilda, quien tiene una huerta donde planta todo tipo de hortalizas que después vende. Tiene una buena cantidad de clientes ya que tiene mucha variedad de hortalizas, y eso le ayuda mucho, pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con la plantación en su huerta. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group El Paraiso is in its second cycle of the Women's Committee program, where they all work within the program to eliminate poverty, fighting to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones. 

One person who stands out is Señora Hilda, who has a garden where she plants all kinds of vegetables, which she later sells. She has many customers because she has a wide variety of vegetables, and this has been a great help to her. She does everything she can to be able to give her family a good life.

She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc., so she can continue planting vegetables in her garden. She is very grateful for the opportunity that everyone in the group has been given to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 24-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband is a fisherman, and she helps her husband with the fishing business. Aside from this, she runs a sari-sari store (variety store). She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net to improve their catch. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, biscuits, chips, candies, sugar, coffee, bread, powdered milk, and chocolate drink.

Divina wishes to improve and expand her business in the future. She also hopes that her son will finish his studies and have a good career some day.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, as well as grocery items for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, biscuits, chips, candies, sugar, coffee, bread, powdered milk, and chocolate drink.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 56-year-old married woman with 4 adult children. She has raised pigs for two years. Her husband supports them financially with his fishing business. They work together to earn a living and to sustain their daily needs.

She wishes to have a sustainable living and abundant life. She requests a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita lives in the town of Carmen, Bohol and has grown rice for six years.
She is married and has a 10-year-old and 9 month-old child. Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily needs.

She has requested10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticide. These are essential items to improve her products, generate higher yield, and increase her income. She wants to settle her obligation and continue to provide for the needs of her family.

Tita is hopeful that her business will become successful and she could finance the her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 33 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Teresa has a business where she buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin is a 28-year-old single man. His mother was his father’s second wife, so he also has a half-sister who shares the same mother with him. His father died of a heart attack last year, so he and his mother had to stick together and support each other. In order to cure the debt from his father’s illness, this family had to sell their house and use all of their savings. Bin had requested loan from Microcred seven months ago to expand his business so that his business survives very well.

This year Bin has been in a relationship with a girl and he wanted to get married. While, unfortunately, his mother got very sick leading to the wedding delay. To cure his mother’s illness, Bin took out all his savings earned this year.

He requested 20,000 CNY from MicroCred. He will use the money to purchase a number of household appliances as stock. Although so many disappointments happened to him, he still believes that he will have a bright future and he will find his own happiness.

loans.use: to purchase a number of household appliances

loans.name: Euis

texts.en:
Hello, lenders!

Meet Euis, one of Ruma's agents. She and her husband live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Euis owns a stall where she sells daily mobile phone airtime credits to her community who need access to such a service. She wanted to join Ruma because she heard that they have the best service and system.

As the business runs, Euis is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for her community, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Euis is with one of the sales executives in her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to the members of the local community who need access to such service.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Los deseos de superación de Yessenia, están a flor de piel, pues a sus 28 años de edad tiene muchas metas por delante, entre ellas, la más próxima es obtener ya su licenciatura en Derecho. Ella, además de estudiar todos los sábados, trabaja, es madre de un pequeño de seis años, está casada y tiene un padre que laapoya al cien por ciento en su profesionalización, con los ingresos de su barbería. 
Yessenia sueña con realizarse profesionalmente, trabajando en el campo de Derecho, pero antes, debe terminar con esta etapa. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de graduación y su título. Esto le permitirá extender su abanico de oportunidades laborales y asegurarle a su hijo un excelente futuro.
texts.en:
Yessenia's self-improvement dreams are out in the open, for her 28 years she has a lot of goals for the future, among them, the first is to obtain her Law degree. In addition to taking classes every Saturday, she works, she is the mother of a 6-year-old, she is married and has a father who she supports 100% in her profession, with the income from her barbershop.

Yessenia dreams of achieving her profession, working in the field of Law, but before, she must finish with this phase. The reason she requests a loan is to pay for her graduation course and her degree. This will allow her to extend her range of work opportunities and ensure that her son has an excellent future.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation course and her degree.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad has raised pigs for 20 years. She is a 67-year-old married woman with 5 children and a resident of Sagbayan, Bohol.

Her husband is a farmer and grows rice.

She is in need of additional funds to purchase piglets.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed to improve her business and income.

In the future, Soledad would like to manage her income properly to become sustainable and to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 58-year-old married hard-working entrepreneur with two children.

Erlinda has had a food vending business for 2 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sugar and oil.

She successfully repaid her previous loan.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and oil.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living raising pigs and wants to borrow 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Mercy wants to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Saroeurn, 53, a farmer living in a small house in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of five children, one of whom is dependent child. Rice farming is the primary source of her income for 15 years. She is able to get supplement income via working as a brick factory worker. Nowadays, she can earn income around 12USD per day. Recently, her crop is growing not well so she cannot sell it for good profit. 
She is now leading a group of four to apply for a loan with VisionFund and this is the first time of her. As the group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion on buying seed and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes to increase the crop yield and be able to get more income to save for future need.

loans.use: to spend on buying seed and fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield and enable her to earn more income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a 43-year-old married woman with one school-aged child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Esperanza has had a frozen goods business for 15 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy hotdogs and ham.

In the future, Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  hotdogs and ham.

loans.name: Rhodaliza

texts.en:
Rhodaliza is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. Rhodaliza works very hard to provide for them.

Rhodaliza has run a general store for 14 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, and soft-drinks.

Rhodaliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.ru:
Мукаддас позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Мукаддас мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Мукаддас выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Мукаддас никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Мукаддас вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Мукаддас выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Мукаддас получает хороший доход. Муж Мукаддас также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Мукаддас с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Мукаддас заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Muqaddas is a positive and hard-working woman. She is married and has five children. She lives in a small rural village. Since her childhood, Muqaddas dreamed of becoming a teacher, but circumstances did not work out for her to get a higher education due to her family's financial limitations. Muqaddas got married immediately after completing secondary school, and she became a homemaker. But even while being constantly at home, Muqaddas never sits idle. She and her husband try to do everything possible in order to provide their children with all the essentials.

In order to have a regular income for food, Muqaddas and her husband began their own business. They rear animals. Muqaddas rears cattle, then sells the meat and milk she gets from them. Muqaddas receives a good income from this business. Muqaddas's husband also works in a local workshop and his work brings the family additional income. Their combined income is sufficient for living at a modest level, but for the time being they do not have enough funds to cover all of the needs that they have. At the present time Muqaddas and her husband want to buy a few more heads of livestock for fattening up. For this reason she has applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy some cattle. Muqaddas is grateful to Arvand in advance for its support as a result of which her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 51 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Herminia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed, a vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Herminia has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, a vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hermenia is 55 years old and has three children who are in school.

Hermenia has a bicycle tranport business in the Philippines. Hermenia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies needed for the maintenance of her business.

Hermenia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Hermenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies needed for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 64 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Isabelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, diapers and other groceries.

In the future Isabelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Librada es un grupo nuevo, donde todas están poniendo su esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza luchando y esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien se dedica a las confecciones variadas, es muy conocida en su barrio y gracias a su buen trabajo se ha hecho de muy buena familia y buena clientela. Ana comenta que se unió al grupo para poder mejorar su emprendimiento por medio de los programas de la fundación.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus confecciones y su buen servicio.
texts.en:
The group Santa Librada is a new group, where everybody is making an effort to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones. They are in the poverty elimination program fighting and striving to improve.

One of the members is Ana. She tailors different things and is very well-known in her neighbourhood. Thanks to her good work she has gained a good reputation and a good clientèle. Ana mentions that she joined the group to be able to improve her undertaking through the programs of the foundation.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics, threads, elastics and other materials so that she can continue with her manufactures and good service.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, elastics and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, es madre soltera de una hija, ella trabaja vendiendo medicinas naturales y químicas, emprendió su propio negocio hace cinco años, lo hace con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, sus esfuerzos son para costear todos los gastos familiares.
Solicita un crédito para comprar analgésicos, vitaminas, jarabes, pomadas, etc., el propósito de la inversión es tener mercadería suficiente para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, espera tener ventas e ingresos más estables.
Sueña con tener un negocio más grande y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca is the single mother of one daughter. She works selling natural and chemical-based medicines. Blanca started her business five years ago, and works from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. Her efforts go towards funding all of her household expenses.

Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase painkillers, vitamins, syrups, ointments, etc. The purpose for the investment is to have sufficient merchandise to improve her service to her customers. She hopes to have more stable sales and income. Blanca's dream is to have a larger business and cover her household necessities.

loans.use: to purchase painkillers, vitamins, syrups, ointments, etc. to have sufficient merchandise to improve her service to her customers.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE.
La socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a member of the communal bank "San Martin de Zurite." She makes a living in agriculture. She is grateful for the loan granted and will comply with the established re-payments.

She is a responsible person, and dedicates much time to this business, which brings her personal satisfaction. She wants to continue to work in this field to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and other items.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 27, is the mother of a 7-year-old boy. She and her family live in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She earns a living by fishing and has been in this business for five years.

Evelyn is asking for a loan to pay for boat maintenance and to buy assorted grocery items and frozen foods. She is planning to start another business for additional earnings. She wants to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance and to buy assorted grocery items and frozen foods.

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is a married 51-year-old mother of three children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Bernaditha has a general store business in the Philippines. Bernaditha requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bernaditha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Bernaditha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 54 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Julieta has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Alicia  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "La Nueva Unión de San Lorenzo". The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

This member, Alicia, works in the business of raising small animals, like guinea pigs and chickens. Alicia helps them to grow and fatten up, and then she sells them at different fairs and markets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Alicia has already been working in this field for four years, and it's going well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the animals. Alicia is asking for the loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens. She is happy to have the loan, and promises to make her payments according to the plan.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Luisa is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Luisa has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Supriadi

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Supriadi again, one of Ruma's agents. Supriadi is a young guy who lives in West Bogor, a suburban area located about a 1.5-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Supriadi owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits for his customers. He joined Ruma because he wants to learn how to handle his business better.

As the business runs, Supriadi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for his community, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Supriadi is in his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
A senhora Lúcia de 29 anos de idade é professora, casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 1 no ensino primário 2 ainda menores sustenta, 1 irmã que vivem com ela  na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  açúcar, amendoim, arroz, óleo, sabão, refrigerantes e bebidas para reforçar o seu negocio.
O seu sonho é  crescer no seu negocio, ser uma grande empresária, concluir a sua outra casa e continuar a sua formação.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a  insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los conta com ajuda de seu esposo.Com os créditos anteriores   construiu a actual casa e adquiriu alguns bens que tem servido de garantia.
texts.en:
Lúcia, 29, is a teacher. She is married and the mother of three children; one of them is in primary school, and the remaining two are still very young. She sustains a sister that lives with her in a house she owns.

She says that with the requested amount she will buy sugar, peanuts, rice, cooking oil, soap, sodas, and other beverages to strengthen her business.

Her dreams are to expand her business, become a great entrepreneur, finish building her another house she has, and continue studying.

She says that her biggest challenge is the lack of funding, but her husband helps her to overcome it. With the previous loans, she built the house where she lives now and bought some goods that helped her to back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, rice, cooking oil, soap, sodas and other beverages for her business.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia Haydee pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores y al negocio de kiosco escolar,  la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia sigue criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos y aumentar animales.
texts.en:
Haydee belongs to the “San Martin de Zurite” communal bank. She continues to make a living by raising small animals and running the school kiosk. She is grateful to be authorized for a loan and promises to comply with the loan repayment schedule.

She raises small animals to later sell to the clients requesting them. She has been working for some time in this business, which provides her personal satisfaction since it allows her a means to help her family get ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy food and more animals.

loans.use: buy food and more animals.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
El Sr. Anastacio  continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio Anastasio solicita el crédito para comprar abono, semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
Anastacio belongs to the “San Martin de Zurite” communal bank. This bank is located in the town of Zurite in the Anta province of the department of Cusco.

Anastacio works in agriculture and livestock. He has been working for a significant time in this business, which is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He is a responsible person. He wants to keep working in this capacity in order to continue helping his family.

Anastacio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and more.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, and more.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina sigue con su negocio de venta de maíz y habas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros,  la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar maíz entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "San Martin de Zurite" communal bank. This bank is located the town of Zurite in the Anta province, in the department of Cusco.

Paulina still has her business selling corn and beans. She is a very responsible and hard-working person. She has been devoted to this business for a considerable amount of time, and among other things, it brings her personal satisfaction.

She still sells her merchandise to customers who want it. She hopes to keep working like this in order to keep supporting her family.

The member is seeking the loan to buy corn, among other things.

loans.use: to buy corn, among other things.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 36 years old and married with three children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Jovelyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 37 years old and married with two children. For the past three years she has raised and sold pigs to gain an income in the Philippines. She also earns additional money by selling vegetables.

Connie has applied for a 10,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pig. Her work is devoted to saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 41, is married and has five children who are currently in school. For the past five years she has earned an income by fishing in the Philippines.

Janet has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 72 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37 years old, married, and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice and operating a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is a 26-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has two children aged three and one year old. Her husband is a fisherman while she also helps her husband in doing this business. They have been doing this work for four years.

Gene is asking a loan for boat repair materials such as plywood and paint. She also buys gasoline for the boat and fishing net to improve their catch. Gene wishes to improve their livelihood for a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy for boat repair materials such as plywood and paint

loans.name: Ma. Elsie

texts.en:
Ma. Elsie is a sari-sari store owner. She sells grocery items such as canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, bread, chips, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, chocolate drink, toiletries, and laundry soap. She also sells gasoline.

Ma. Elsie has been running this business for four years. She is requesting a loan to buy grocery items (mention earlier) and gasoline. She wishes in the future to improve and expand her business for her children.

In addition, Ma. Elsie is a mother of two children, ages 15 and 12. She is a 45-year-old woman and from Carles, Iloilo

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, bread, chips, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, chocolate drink, toiletries and laundry soap, and gasoline.

loans.name: Lenelyn

texts.en:
Lenelyn and her husband are engaged in the fishing business like most people in the community of Carles, Iloilo. They have been doing this for two years to earn a living.

Lenelyn is asking a loan to buy fishing net and gasoline for their fishing boat. She is a 26-year-old woman and a mother of three children. Her oldest child is eight years old and her youngest child is two years old. In the future, Lenelyn dreams of being successful. She dreams of being rich.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, 55, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. For the past twenty years she has produced peanut butter to sell in the Philippines.

Lolita has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients to make peanut butter to sell. She wants to build up her business so as to give her family a stable and secure future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make peanut butter to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman, 63 years old and has four children. For the past three years she has sold school supplies to earn an income in the Philippines.

Evelyn has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more school supplies to sell. She wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

Emma has been in this business for three years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is a 29-year-old man and a motorcycle owner who drives to earn a living. He is a resident of Carles, Iloilo.

Leo is a father of a three-year-old girl and his wife is a housekeeper. He works hard to give them a comfortable living.

He has been driving his motorcycle for three years. Thus, he is asking a loan for his motorcycle improvement and maintenance. He wishes in the future to improve his livelihood for his family.

loans.use: pay for motorcycle improvement and maintenance.

loans.name: Remera

texts.en:
Remera is a widowed woman, 61 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her fishing business.

Remera has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years old, married, and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jane has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and married with five children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, bread, eggs, coffee, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Marites has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, bread, eggs, coffee, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 39-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has five children, ages 16, 15, 14, 11, and 8 years old.

Her husband works hard as a carpenter while Gina is engaged in buying and selling rice. She has been doing this kind of business for three years.

She is asking a loan to buy sacks of rice to sell in order to increase their livelihood. Thus, she dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is married to a fisherman and lives in Carles, which is located in Iloilo. She has two children aged seven and four years. Jasmin runs a sari-sari, or small grocery store to earn a living. She has been in business for more than four years and works hard with her husband to provide their children with a good education.

Jasmin has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy groceries to sell such as chocolate bars, chips, candies, bread, biscuits, laundry soap, toiletries, spices, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. She also wants to buy gasoline for their fishing boat.

Jasmin is always working to establish an improved and sustainable livelihood for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Catherine has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from frozen foods vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 38 years old and has three children. Dolores is married and has three children who are in school.

Dolores is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and corn in the Philippines. Dolores requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dolores has been farming vegetables and corn for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 42 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Fe has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Juve

texts.en:
Juve is 35 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juve has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 51, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. For the past four years she has raised and sold pigs to earn an income in the Philippines.

Marlyn has taken out and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for an 8,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to care for her pigs. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to care for her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mila is 43 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Mila has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like woods, nails, etc. for her business.

Mila has been in this business for 19 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like woods, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cherry May

texts.en:
Cherry May is 40 years old and married with one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

Cherry May has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Fishing is the main source of income in most communities in the town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. Levy and her husband have also been engaged in this business for more than eight years.

Levy is a 58-year-old woman with four adult children and one school-aged child, age 18 years old. She is asking for a loan to help them increase their catch by buying new fishing net and gasoline for their fishing boat.

In the future, Levy dreams to become well-off in their living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and gasoline.

loans.name: Nopian Rijal

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Nopian, one of Ruma's agents. Nopian and his wife live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. They have been blessed with two children.

They own and manage a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity.

As the business runs, Nopian is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends.

In the photo, Nopian is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to those who need access to such service.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 43 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are presently in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marivic has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lucinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lucinda has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sabina pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de verduras,  la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,azucar,leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Sabina is an associate of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” Communal Bank; the bank is located in the Zurite district, which is part of the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The associate continues to run her grocery and fruit and vegetable store. She is a responsible person. She has been running her business for a while now and it's going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.

The associate would like to continue working as she is in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy, among others, rice, sugar and milk.

loans.use: buy, among others, rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is an energetic woman residing in the town of Pilar, Bohol. She engages in a food vending business. She sells snack foods like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar), ice candy, orange-flavored juice, hot cake, and puto (rice cake) near the school canteen in her place.

She is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children. Her eldest is 15, and the youngest is 1. Her husband has an income that could support the family's daily needs.

She decided to avail herself of a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP to buy ingredients such as flour, baking powder, cooking oil, margarine, and assorted fruit-flavored juices. With this, she could purchase more supplies and be able to roll out her capital, and she would be able to pay her obligation and continue to provide for the needs of her growing children.

Rachel hopes that this humble livelihood will become productive in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, baking powder, cooking oil, margarine, and assorted fruit-flavored juices.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 47 years old and married with two children. With her two children currently in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Pepita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for 32 years now.

Pepita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Andi, one of Ruma's agents. Andi is a young guy who lives in West Bogor, a suburban area located about a 1.5 hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He owns and manages a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits, mobile phone accessories and watches for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity. Andi himself is a young guy who has a very big spirit to become an entrepreneur.

As the business runs, Andi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on the weekends.

In the photo, Andi is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime purchases  for members of his local community.

loans.name: Pati Ibed

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Pati Ibed  continua dedicándose  a la ganadería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le  pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en:
Pati Ibed is an associate of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” Communal Bank; The bank is located in the Zurite district, which is part of the province of Anta in the department of Cusco.

The associate, continues to run her livestock business. She is a responsible, hard-working person. She's been running her business for a while now and it's going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.

The associate is grateful for the loan and she promises to fulfill her payments as this is the way she will be able to move forward with her family.

She is requesting the loan to fix her stable.

loans.use: fix her stable.

loans.name: Flora Silveria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Flora Silveria se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Flora Silveria is an associate of the “LA NUEVA UNION DE SAN LORENZO” (The New Union of San Lorenzo) Communal Bank; the bank is located in the Vilcabamba district, which is part of the province of La Convencion and the department of Cusco.

The associate runs a grocery and restaurant business. She sells basic needs products, like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. Through the benefits of her business, she'd like to move forward in her life. The associate is a hard-working, enterprising woman.

The associate's dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

She is happy for the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Hassel Anne

texts.en:
Hassel Anne is a single woman who is 27 years old, with one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothes and used shoes business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes and shoes to sell.

Hassel Anne has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Retchelda

texts.en:
Retchelda is 59 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Retchelda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from weaving and personal collection. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 41 years old and married, with six children. Four of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials needed for her furniture making business.

Elma has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa is 65 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Nilfa is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her goat.

Nilfa has been in this business for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her goat.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 33-year-old widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merlyn sells beauty products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Merlyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy beauty products to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Mary- An

texts.en:
Mary-An is 47 years old; she's married and has five children. She has been involved with farming activities to earn a living.

She has a piggery business and has been operating it for almost five years. She earns well and this become her main source of income.

Recently, she took a loan from GDMPC to buy feed for her piglets.

In the future, she wants to sustain her business and wants to save her profit to use for a better future with her own family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 39 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

Charlotte has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fishing and rice retailing.

Charlotte aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, sugar, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Renalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mechelle

texts.en:
Mechelle is 30 years old and married with three children presently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, breads, eggs, etc.

Mechelle has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, breads, eggs, etc

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 62 years old; she is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Thelma has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials needed for her furniture making business.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise pigs for her pig-fattening business.

Silvina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from sewing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Silvina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She dreams of savng enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ramilyn

texts.en:
Ramilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ramilyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marco, ve en los créditos una herramienta importante para seguir teniendo su negocio con un buen inventario, hace la solicitud de un financiamiento para comprar ganado y cerdos, podrá mantener la continuidad de su negocio y la satisfacción de los clientes,
Al administrar de manera correcta el crédito anterior su negocio se mantiene y genera un mejor margen de ganancias.
texts.en: In the loans, Marco sees an important tool for continuing with his business with a good inventory. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle and pigs, and to keep on with his business and maintain his customers' satisfaction. By managing his previous loan well, his business keeps on running and he generates a better margin of earnings.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs, and to keep on with his business and maintain his customers' satisfaction.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN RECIÉN CASADO SU ESPOSA SE ENCUENTRA EMBARAZADA DE SU PRIMER HIJO, SIN EMBARGO EL EMBARAZO FUE DIAGNOSTICADO DE ALTO RIESGO POR LO QUE SU GINECÓLOGO PROPONE QUE EL PARTO SEA POR CESÁREA PARA EVITAR RIESGOS AL BEBE. SU ESPOSA TUVO QUE DEJAR DE TRABAJAR POR LA MISMA SITUACIÓN DE ALTO RIESGO.
texts.en: This young borrower was recently married, and his wife is pregnant with their first child.  However, her pregnancy has been deemed "high risk" and so her gynecologist has recommended that she have a cesarean section to avoid risks to the baby.  His wife also had to take time off from work because of the high risk pregnancy.

loans.use: to pay for a cesarean section delivery for his wife

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 3 years now.

Miguelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Deimer Enrique

texts.es: Deimer es un joven emprendedor que desde hace 2 años instaló un pequeño almacén en su casa ubicada en un barrio popular de la ciudad de Barranquilla, como una forma de generar ingresos y atendiendo las recomendaciones de sus padres quienes le plantearon la idea como un reto pues en el sector no existía este tipo de negocio. Su negocio está abierto diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. y vende a vecinos y transeúntes artículos de papelería, cosméticos, accesorios, regalos, productos de aseo, entre otros. Con el tiempo y al ver las necesidades de los vecinos, decidió ampliar su oferta con el alquiler de lavadoras, actividad que le genera un ingreso adicional. Actualmente Deimer está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual planea invertir en la compra de cosméticos, accesorios, regalos, productos de aseo, entre otros, para incrementar su oferta para la temporada de fin de año.  Deimer sueña con ver crecer su negocio, remodelar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Deimer is an enterprising young man who 2 years ago, set up a small store in his home, located in a popular neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla, as a way of generating income and following the recommendations of his parents who planted the idea in his head as a challenge since this type of business didn't exist in the area.  His business is open daily from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and he sells to his neighbors and visitors paper products, cosmetics, accessories, gifts, and cleaning products, among other things.  With time and seeing the need of his neighbors, he decided to expand his business by renting washing machines, which generates additional income.  Currently, Deimer is requesting his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he plans to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, accessories, gifts, and cleaning products, among other things, to increase his stock for the end of the year season.  Deimer dreams of seeing his business grow, remodeling his home and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, accessories, gifts, and cleaning products, among other things.

loans.name: Elva Isabel

texts.es:
Elva es casada, vive con su esposo, dos de sus hijos y su madre, por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia decidió fundar su negocio propio de venta de productos de belleza como: cosméticos, lociones, cremas corporales y productos de limpieza, practica está actividad desde hace 15 años, trabaja de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, lo atiende con ayuda de dos empleados, es un negocio que nació por sus deseos de superación.
El capital que pide prestado le servirá para comprar lociones, cosméticos, cremas corporales, tratamientos para el cabello, así como también desinfectantes para limpieza al mayoreo, le permitirá tener un mejor inventario bien surtido para disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes además espera tener nuevas ganancias.
Elva tiene como proyecto continuar mejorando su negocio para tener los recursos económicos necesarios para apoyar a su hijo a que termine la carrera de medicina y para cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Elva is married and lives with her husband, 2 of her children, and her mother. Out of the need to get her family ahead, she decided to found her own business selling beauty products, such as: cosmetics, lotions, body creams, and cleaning products. She has been in this business for 15 years and works from 7 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon. She tends the business with the help of 2 employees.

It is a business that was born of her desires for self-improvement. The loan she has requested will work to buy lotions, cosmetics, body creams, hair treatments, as well as disinfectants wholesale. It will allow her to have a better, well-stocked inventory in order to address her clients' needs. In addition, she hopes to have new profits.

Elva has a plan to continue improving her business to have the economic resources necessary to support her child until he finishes his medical degree and to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy lotions, cosmetics, body creams, hair treatments, as well as disinfectants wholesale.

loans.name: Aida Margot

texts.es:
Aida con ayuda de préstamos puede seguir teniendo a su disipación la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pan, tamales y tortillas, de esta manera ella genera los ingresos suficientes para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar, ha involucrado mucho más a sus hijos en su negocio para que puedan ir adquiriendo experiencia y luego puedan ser independientes.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito con el que comprara básicamente maíz, leña, manteca, canela, verduras, etc., materiales para continuar elaborando la venta de tortillas, pan y tamales, tiene la esperanza que los resultados de la inversión sean positivos como anteriormente han sido.
texts.en:
With the help of loans, Aida can continue to have the raw ingredients on hand that she needs to sell bread, tamales, and tortillas. This is how she generates sufficient income to lessen her household's needs. She has involved her children in her business a lot more, so that they can acquire experience and later can be independent.


She needs another loan, with which she will buy corn, firewood, butter, cinnamon, vegetables, etc. basically (materials to continue selling tortillas, bread, and tamales). She hopes that the results of the loan will be positive, as they have been in the past.

loans.use: to buy basically corn, firewood, butter, cinnamon, vegetables, etc. -- materials to continue selling tortillas, bread, and tamales

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La prestataria es madre de dos hijos pequeños, su esposo realiza trabajos eventuales y sus ingresos son limitados. Ha intentado buscar un trabajo más estable pero ya que no ha terminado la secundaria le es muy difícil conseguir trabajo. La prestataria desea emprender un negocio de venta de ropa a domicilio. Cuenta con  experiencia en el rubro porque antes ha apoyando a una señora que realizaba la misma actividad; de esta manera generará más ingresos a su familia y apoyará a la educación a sus hijos. 

Debe comprar mercadería, seleccionar las prendas por tallas y visitar a sus clientes. La prestataria está muy segura y optimista porque el negocio es  rentable y la experiencia adquirida le da mayor confianza. Además, trabajará de la mano con una amiga de confianza que tiene experiencia también el rubro y mantiene contacto con clientes que facilitan el funcionamiento de este negocio.

Necesita un préstamo para comprar camisetas, pantalones, leggings, jeans, entre otras prendas. En un futuro desearía poder aumentar su capital para tener más mercadería que vender.
texts.en:
This borrower is the mother of 2 young children.  Her husband does temporary jobs, and has a limited income.  He tried to find more stable work, but since he never finished high school it is very difficult for him to find work.  This borrower wants to start up a business selling clothing from her home.  She has experience in this line of work, because before she used to help a woman who had a similar business.  In this way, she will be able to generate more income for her family and support her children in their education.  

This borrower needs to buy merchandise, select clothes by sizes, and visit her customers.  She is very certain and optimistic that this business is profitable; her experience gives her greater confidence.  Also, she will work with a trusted friend who also has experience in this line of work and maintains contact with customers who will make it easier to operate this business.

This borrower needs a loan to buy t-shirts, pants, leggings, jeans, and other garments.  In the future, she would like to be able to expand her capital so that she can have more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, spices, fish, etc.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rowena has a coconut wine business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 74 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Pacencia has a business selling used tires in the Philippines. Pacencia requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more tires to sell.

Pacencia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Pacencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tires to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vanessa has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Vanessa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other materials for the maintenance of her business.

Vanessa has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Vanessa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other materials for the maintenance of her transportation business.

loans.name: Saul Alfonso

texts.es:
Saúl, hace la petición de un nuevo financiamiento para poder invertirlo en calzado e insumos para la tienda como: bebidas, golosinas, huevos, sal, azúcar y otros productos para atender día con día a sus clientes.
Con el financiamiento anterior fortaleció el negocio y ha generado más ingresos para subsistir y mantener la puntualidad de sus pagos, agradece mucho el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Saúl is requesting a new loan to invest in footwear and supplies for his store, like beverages, sweets, eggs, salt, sugar and other products, so he can attend to his clients from day to day.
